reviews.review: Really cool ara. Lots of restaurants. Great place to people watch in a historic setting. Loved the views during the day and night.
Tout country but still a nice place to chill. Yes.. hanging around here will trigger a lot of 'machu pucchu' requests... but nevertheless you cannot say no to an open space in a city

Sat on a bench, strangers took our picture?. I passed through Plaza de Armas multiple times a day while on my 3 day visit to Cusco before my Machu Picchu trek. The plaza is nice. There are a lot of stores that cater to tourists and there are plenty of restaurants (fairly mediocre, the better ones are away from the plaza). There are people selling art and offering massages. The cathedral is definitely worth a visit. What I didn't like is that when my travel partner and I sat on a bench to take it all in and just enjoy the afternoon, we were pretty much bombarded by the people selling art and massages. And, oddly enough, a woman and her husband who also appeared to be tourists asked to take a picture with us. The only reason I can think of is because my travel partner is well over 6 feet tall and we are both fair skinned and light eyed. It was definitely odd, but makes for a great story!

Great place to see it all!. When walking around Cusco you feel much more connected to the Incan past and history than in Lima. The buildings seem more natural, the people more authentic, and the history more alive. If you visit Peru, use Lima as a arrival and departure destination. But come to Cusco, to get the full Peruvian experience.

The heart of Cusco. Plaza de Armas is the heart of Cusco. Stately and charming, life bustles all day. You can find people of all nationalities photographing, walking, shopping ... or just admiring the colonial architectural beauties that surround the square. Close your eyes and listen what people are talking, you can imagine being in Europe or anywhere in the world.If you go to Cusco, be sure to spend time in a restaurant at the Plaza or simply sit on the steps of the cathedral and enjoy ...

Very nice main square. The very heart of the Cuzco, La Plaza de Armas is a place where to go. A mix of bugglairs, tourist, masseuses, lamas, cucarachas. "Free" tours of the city depart from here, but they are not actually free.

inhaling culture at the center of it all. Arriving in Cusco at dusk, Plaza de Armas was teeming with life - tour vendors and tourists alike. For a hungry soul who is hunting for something to chow, the place was packed with quaint and interesring restaurants. I have a favorite one that serves quality Peruvian dishes (too bad I have goldfish memory)I had my shopping spree of Baby Alpaca ponchos here! The best I scored

What a neat, clean, beautiful and friendly place to visit. The Plaza de Armas within the town of Cusco is a wonderful place to visit. It is neat, clean, beautiful and friendly! We could wander around this area forever taking in it's charm, and never an uneasy or unsafe feeling.We were fortunate enough to be in this charming town for the Corpus Christi Celebration! WOW, do these people know how to party! No seriously, it's a holiday much like our 4th of July, with family picnics, sharing of their traditional dish couy, food and drink on every corner, and a celebration of not only the body & blood of Christ, but several saints as well (like 16), with an outdoor Mass in front of the Cathedral with hundreds of people! They parade the Eucharist on this MASSIVE float around the square, then throughout the day, on the shoulders of many men the 16 different saints! It was a sight to behold, and I felt blessed to be able to witness this wonderful celebration.
Very nice square . The hustling centre of town, the plaza is a must see in Cusco. Plenty of shops, restaurants and hotels nearby. Nice at day or night.

A majestic square full of people, a lovely fountain, a pedestrian thoroughfare. this is the spot to people watch, enjoy the activities by day or night, use it to get around the town. there are churches, restaurants, taxis all around. The cathedral steps give you a seat to the spectacle.

Good Place to visit. It is nice place to see, especially catching the security shift change ceremony, Around the plaza, there are many good and cheap restaurants. Those executive lunch are very fast and cheap, but good quality.

Hub of the City. You can not go to Cusco and not visit Plaza de Armas. This is the city's main square, flanked by restaurants that vie for your business. Tip: try to come by early in the morning, just before sunrise and you will have spectacular pictures.
A little bit of history. Great tourist location to hang out and see the crowd and get feel of the locals. Nice hotels close by and great restuarants too.
Center Point. There are so many things to see around the plaza from several cathedrals to many shops and restaurants.

One of the most beautiful square. The main square with a beautifil church, nice building with beautiful balcony that turned into bar& restaurant that you can stop for a beer or chica while enjoying the view.
Walk around plaza de armas. Walking around plaza de armas allows you to find stores, restaurants an local people! Buy beautiful stuff handcrafted, and discover a little of cuscos culture

Beautiful. A relatively touristy place, but worth walking through. At night, it totally transforms and feels like another world. Like most large cities, you are warned to watch for pick pockets and purse snatchers. This area seemed well patrolled by uniformed and non uniformed police. Unobtrusive, but there. Most of the people were very polite, and the area is very clean.
Wow!. A great place to visit... Safe at that as you see police presence everywhere... Lots of choices for food & drinks...
Main square. This is the main square in cusco and is buzzing all the time with different things happening the square is beautiful and has plenty of shops and cafes

Amazing square. The views from the square are amazing, never failed to take our breath away. The square is always bustling and plenty of people advertising bus tours and free walking tours, we would recommend the walk with Marco that we took, they wear blue t shirts. The walk is fun and informative and the guide puts his own spin on some things but very interesting and get shown things u wouldnt see otherwise. The square is full of bars and restaurants, all good and safe place to be.
Beautiful . Next to the Cathedral, la Plaza de Armas is a wonderful and beautiful spot in Cusco that you must visit when in Cusco

A beautiful place connecting past and present. The plaza is surrounded by historical buildings with a beautiful view of mountains. There are many restaurants around the place. This is the centre of Cusco and everyone should pay a visit.
Nice Square. Cusco's major church is on the square close to the Temple of the Sun. We did not go into the churches, but rather just wandered around and took and pictures and watched the people.

It's a large big loud square where all the action happens.. Many of the restaurants are around this square. Do not fall for the guys that try to sell you prints "That they did themselves". They did not, buy your art in the many galleries or art shops not off the street in the Plaza De Arms. Good restaurants, ask your Hotel and they will guide you. Don't take drinks with ice, the water is NOT filters. Do not do smoothies, for it's mostly ice. Cold beer works well or lovely wine. The best shopping is not on the Plaza but on the small streets surrounding the Plaza.
Nice. A very nice plaza. Especially at night with the view on the mountains and the churches. There's a good atmosphere here. And of course a Starbucks :)

You will go there! . Easy centered place, with tons of culture and history. Lots of qhichwa people selling hand crafted silks during the day (they actually annoy a bit, but if you know how to spell "no gracias", will be just fine). During the night, the cliff buildings just add a rain of lights over the plaza that is awesome! Lots of great restaurants nearby! Aaaaaand it's free!

Classic central plaza. Actually, the largest remaining of the original plaza now divided into three individuals, this bright and airy square is flanked by the cathedral on one side and arcades of shops and restaurants on the other three. Some of the street peddlers can be over insistent, but otherwise a great place to enjoy the culture, food, and historic offerings of Cusco.

Great little Italian restuarant opp the Cathedral. The Plaza is a wonderful site.. but where to eat, Limo is nice from upstairs you can gaze over the square, but our favourite doesn't have. View! It's Position.

A wonderful senset in Cuzco. Plaza de Armas is an obligatory stop in Cuzco. Many of the most famous restaurants are located there and is also near of banks and money exchange stores. It is possible to seat in a balcony and watch the city from above. We went to Cappuccino Café and took great pictures, then we went to Papacho's restaurant (of Gaston Acurio) in the opposite side of the Plaza to have some beers during the sunset. This was a really amazing experience, as we could take incrible pictures from both views of the Plaza.
Beautiful. Backdrop around the Plaza is great, views of mountains looks like a photoshop. Beautiful Building surround the square.
Very beautiful.. It is a must see location when you are in Cusco. Is the main Plaza in the city, very beautiful, charming, great place to be!!

Serene at night!. The Plaza de Armas, or the main square in Cusco town is quite special with the cathedral on one side and the park in the middle. We enjoyed taking many photographs here and also some nice ones at sunset. All sides of the square is dotted with restaurants and shops selling souvenirs.
Pretty square. Hive of activity at night, plenty of shops bars and restaurants to spend the evening whilst taking in the atmosphere of a beautiful city
My Evening Hub. Plaza de Armas is my favorite spot in Cusco. I spend my evenings reading book by sitting on one of the benches out there. Best place to pick up souvenirs for cheap.

Very nice plaza. We have visited this plaza several times over the past few days. It is a nice place both during the day and in the evening.
We have also been lucky enough to see two parades around the plaza.
Plaza de Armas. A great place to enjoy Cusco and people-watch. Lots of activities. Enjoyed the llamas ready to take a picture with you!

Beautiful buildings. As well as the stunning, historical architecture, there are some great views available from the many restaurants and coffee shops that have open windows above the square. Pretty odd to see the Army suddenly emerge, jogging around the square in some military exercise.

Fantastic evening vibe. We walked through the plaza everyday and sat on the benches admiring the gardens and people going by. Its a wonderful place to just relax in after dinner. There are fabulous restaurants all over the square. The imposing, beautiful statue of Pachacuti stands guard. You are reminded of a different time in the city's history. A definite must see!

LOTS to see in this plaza!. There is a solid combination of tourist restaurants, mainstream American fast-food (that is actually REALLY SLOW), souvenirs shops, museums and churches! The plaza is clean and there are several harmless dogs roaming around. There is also a handful of locals selling their wares, but be ready to bargain. We were told that this is a part of their culture. If you like people-watching, this is your place. From locals, tourists and even Pokemon Go peeps, there is a lot to see. Simply sit on a bench and enjoy!
Crowded. Colonial style square surrounded by shops, the cathedral and a large church a must visit place in Cusco.

Very crowded!. This area is extremely crowded, with parades pretty much every day. Would definitely recommend visiting places off the plaza instead of in it. And be prepared to be asked if you want a massage at least 20 times!
Great downtown area. Nice meeting point, with many shops and restaurants very close by. But it is also a place with many tourist.
Lovely plaza! . Really nice, open plaza with beautiful buildings surrounding it. Traffic is kept off the main square so it is pleasant to sit in or walk around.
Can't miss. This is the center of Cusco. The plaza is surrounded by the Cathedral, shops of many kinds, restaurants and of course there are many persistently pleasant street vendors.

A must-see, you literally can't miss. Taking Cusco's size into account and the location of its attractions, you won't have to worry you'll mis this square. It's definitely worth a visit, since it offers nice views on the cathedral, churches and colonial houses with a stunning backdrop of mountains. Ignore the street sellers and enjoy the shops, sights or ceremonies like taking the flags down at sunset. Other squares are more relaxed and often have little markets on it, but this one is the prettiest one.
Amazing witness of turbulent times. charming place in the Center of Cusco, withes of dramatic events in the history of the city, surrounded by historical buildings

Beautiful main square. This place is very beautiful and please stop on all the corners to take pictures from different angles. As this is the main square lot of touristic restaurants around and expensive. Bit if u get a chance visit once of the restaurant with a balcony and just enjoy the view. Also near the fountain or on the stairs of church, one can sot and just watch the city and tourists pass by. Beautiful square and I think no one will pass Cusco without being here.

Beautiful, lively plaza...but there are much better places to eat and hang out. You're in Cusco: *of course* you're going to go see the Plaza de Armes and should. It's beautiful and in the few days I was there, I saw two huge parades during the day that were so much fun. It buzzes with life...which is both an advantage and a disadvantage. At the plaza, you'll always be approached by touts selling something or trying to get you into their restaurants, which can become incredibly annoying. Also, the restaurants on the plaza are generally overpriced without necessarily offering great quality or even value for the cost. Come here to take in the scenery, but it's better to head to San Blas (or even further afield) to find good food and fewer people trying to make a quick buck off of tourists.

Beautiful. Always something going on!. Each day that I was in Cusco, I would always find myself here at some point in the day. Definitely the center of so much! Lots of restaurants, stores, and great place to just sit and watch all the people. It seemed like there was one event or another happening all the time. I felt safe there on my own too. Beautiful plaza!
Great Plaza. Had all the ingredients of a great plaza. Historic buildings, street performers, sidewalk cafes (bars). And the main ingredient of lots of different people. Grab a seat and enjoy.

Beautiful plaza! . The main square in the old town of Cusco, a must if you are in the city!
Beautiful buildings, restaurants and stores!

Beautiful Plaza, lots of great bars and restaurants. Stayed at hotel just around the corner from here (Tierra Viva Plaza) and loved spending time in the Plaza. Plenty of good places to eat and drink, beautiful setting too. Try one of the bars or restaurants with an outdoor terrace or balcony and sit back and enjoy the vibrant Plaza with a cold beer or glass of wine. So glad we stayed here rather than Lima - really memorable. Lots of parades and festivals throughout our 4 days here, definitely recommended.

See above for inclusive review.. I can recommend eating at a restaurant called Papillion. The view of the Plaza from their second story balcony is terrific. But there are also a number of other restaurants surrounding the square which have similar balconies.

Adorable little area . Nice area to hang around, and enjoy the unique culture and surrounding of Cusco. We enjoyed walking around this Plaza! The architecture and the area's landscape was pretty amazing. Shops and restaurants are everywhere and around the block with so many options to choose from.

Active central Plaza . Loved hanging out in the plaza. The only downside is, if you spend time there, you will constantly get hit up for massage services, shoe shine, artwork, trinkets and restaurants. That part is annoying. The plaza was constantly full of parades, music and some protest rallies. Some really good restaurants around it and guide services, money changers and stores.
Breathtaking. WOW, stunning.The architectureThe whole area is amazing You have to see it for yourselfPhotos don't do justice

Lovely square in Cusco. Lovely square to spend sime time contemplating the Cathedral (which I strongly suggest to visit) and the hills surrounding Cusco (expecially before dusk). The only negative note is that is full of tedious people trying to sell anything to turists.

A nice place and real city centre of Cuzco. The Plaza de Armes at Cuzco is a nice place to be. It's the centre of different kind of social activities and parades, like folkloristic, religious, political, etc. etc. etc.
Gorgeous at night. Perfect for an evening stroll! Find a bench, read a book, people watch, grab some coffee or a snack, you can't go wrong! The plaza is very clean, open and has great energy!
Beautiful Place. The plaza is realy beautiful and clean. You have everything around there to do. Lots of restaurants, shops and people. Great place to start knowing Cusco.
Lovely. We had the pleasure of seeing a regional dance exposition in the square recently. It is such a great place to people watch and enjoy the sights of Cusco.

WHERE EVERYTHING STARTS. Located smack in the middle of Cusco's historical district every tour should start from there. From there you can observe the contrast between the Inca and Spanish cultures. Great place to see the local population milling about. There are traditional markets everywhere along the outskirts of the Plaza. You can even find a KFC and a McDo and an Irish Pub. The whole plaza is surrounded by patrimonial buildings and the fantastic JesusChrist company basilica

Centre of Everything in Cusco. A bustling and vibrant centre of town. At the time we were there, there was a festival celebration with dancers, bands and plenty of activity. Scenic views, fountains, buildings - plenty of great photo opportunities. There is a number of hotels close by and eating places abound.

Cusco's main square - try to find a hotel near here. Cusco is a really special little city and Plaza de Armas is the centerpiece. This neighborhood is where you should stay in Cusco. Yes, lots of tourists but also the hub of the city. When we were here, surrounding the Winter Solstice and celebration of the dry season, Cusco was beautifully decorated.

Lively and bustling. Whatever time of day the square is always busy - families, tourists, entertainers, street hawkers in traditional clothes. Surrounded by beautiful churches, shops and restaurants. Lovely wooden balconies.

Bustling main square. Beautiful main square in Cusco, with nice seating areas & lovely views of the city. Religious & traditional parades often pass through here so a good place to watch the world go by.

Best part of the city. After initially being disappointed when arriving in Cusco, when I discovered the historical centre I was very impressed. Some greats site to look at and visit, and plenty of inexpensive restaurants and cafes around the main square. Also something to look at, and it felt safe

Beautiful and interesting plaza. Our hotel was just off the plaza and we visited in more detail during a Cusco city tour. There are many shops and restaurants around the place, but also a lot of history, with the cathedral and other architecture. Definitely worth spending some time here when visiting Cusco.
Great Plaza de Armas. Great plaza with two Churches and tons of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Very clean, very safe, with some kind of celebration going on just about everyday.

Lots of things going on. So much things to see. I especially liked this square at night. We would eat dinner and after dinner would find lots of activity from both locals and tourists. The time we went the locals were practicing performances for the anniversary festival the following week. It was such a nice ambiance to be around. Lots of places to eat and grab a drink/coffee.

Beautiful architecture. Amazing architecture that reminds me of Europe (of course) with the mountainous terrain in the background. There is a mix of the Catholic European and the local Quechua cultures. It was always fairly busy, and one day there was a political rally. This is the rather "Americanized" area with KFC and Starbucks and REI-like stores, but at least they maintain structural integrity of historic buildings around them. The religious circuit tour begins at the Cathedral here, and it is worth seeing. When in Cusco, definitely learn how to get to and from this plaza because most places are described in relation to it.

Beautiful!. This city plaza is a short 10 minute walk from the Palacio del Inka hotel. The hotel staff recommended a few restaurants in this plaza and they were all excellent. The plaza is always busy and we were fortunate enough to see a few parades. I highly recommend visiting this city center.

Definitely worth a walk around, particularly at sunset. This is a wonderful old square, with fatnastic old buildings on all sides of the square. It is quite touristy but it is a good place to hang out if you just want to watch the world go by. There is a great view of this square from the roads above it. Just take one of the roads near the cathedral and walk up. You will eventually get to a place with a fantastic view of this beautiful place.

Watch Parade. We happened to be there on a Sunday and there were parades going on. It's very interesting to see people dressed in the Incan costume to enact ancient ceremonies. It's a nice place to people watch in Cuzco.

Fun middle of town square.. Good place to people watch. Lots of activities going on daily. Bars are a bit expensive, but that is to be expected. Lots of street vendors, feel free to bargain. Highly recommended.

A must while in Cusco. This is free and a must stop while in Cusco. We happened to wander through as local dance groups were having a competition of traditional Inca dancing. We ended up staying around a while to watch a few of the troupes dance. There is no need to stay for so long but a must stop while in Cusco.
Heart of Cusco. Huge plaza serving as the heart of the city. Cusco is very walkable and the plaza is a nice point of reference. Very safe day or night.
Lively town center. Saw great performances at this venue, perhaps a festival was on at the time of my visit. So several processions with dance performances were observed. I liked the environment

Cool meeting spot. The "park" is just a central place to meet...it had a cool statue/water decor thing, forgot what they're called sorry, but it's lined with little restaurants, bars, and shops...this makes it a great jumping off point...you can also get city bus tours from here, they walk you to a sketchy little room behind other rooms but it's actually really legit, I recommend doing at least the short one to see at Blanco de Christo it's really cool

Beautiful place . Nice place to be , take pictures with the olds Peruvian ladies in typically clothes and the llamas, be carefully with the price of the shoeshine boys some times is very overpriced , also they will offer you ayahuasca or weed to be connected with the Pacha Mama in your trip to Machu Picchu, note is almost impossible to find something like that in Ollantaytambo or Aguascalientes.Lot of restaurants around, maybe you have time to taste the guinea pigs or the wonderful Peruvian ceviche and don't forget the pisco sour !!!!If you have problems , you can find in every corner the tourist police, they well be there for your needs.

A must see in Cusco. A very lovely square which seems to be filled with people at all hours, often with bands or performances by children, depending on the day. A place not just where tourists congregate but a plaza used by Cusquenos where one can get a real feel of the the community. Outstanding religious and secular architechure lines this inviting traditional space.

Lovely square in heart of Cusco. Nice square just to sit around or watch some dancing if you are lucky .
Only downside is being constantly pestered by people selling .
Just keep saying no and enjoy this place .

Beautiful!. We visited a few plazas during our trip to Peru. The Plaza de Armas in Cusco is probably my favorite. There's a lot to see in this beautiful place. You can take a leisurely stroll and admire the beautiful architecture of the old buildings, try delicious Peruvian cuisine in one the many quaint restaurants nearby, or enjoy the view of the surrounding mountains. A visit to this place is probably perfect on your first day, to adjust to the high altitude in Cusco. We got altitude sickness when we arrived because we went on a tour right away. Our guide told us that it was better to rest on the first day or to just take walks around town if you want to explore the place.
Nice town square. Lots of people, people-watching, junk sellers and restaurants. It's fun to wander around. Plenty of police, so always felt safe.
Nice plaza. This plaza is big, surrounded by historical buildings to visit as well as restaurants and tourists shop. It is clean, central and easily accessible.
Center Of Cusco. It is the main plaza in Cusco with government buildings and churches on all 4 sides.Lots of activates always going on in the plaza.

What could I possibly say?. I've been to many cities and seen many squares and plazas. Not many have taken be aback quite like Plaza de Armas. I walked there my first night from my hotel and as soon as it opened up to me, I was in love. Hundreds of incredible restaurants, shops, boutiques and cafe's. You will find markets and pharmacies there, as well, but a quick tip - if you plan to use your credit card for anything in a pharmacy or market, you will need your passport. Otherwise, cash only.There are many people selling goods like paintings, alpaca gloves and hats, arts and crafts and other types of "home-made" rememberances. Don't be afraid to bargain, they're expecting it. Also, many women offering massages and men offering discounts on restaurants. Despite all there is to do or see just in this square, my highest recommendation is to sit on one of benches with a bottle of water or coffee and simply people watch. Enjoy!

One of the most beautiful plazas I've visited in S.A. An absolutely stunning plaza to sit and people watch. With Cusco's glorious weather, it is great to get some sun and either wait to be sold something or think of good ways to tell people you aren't interested. I only wish you could sit/lay on the grass, although I realise a lot of work goes into maintaining the gardens, the Gardeners do a wonderful job.

A place to people watch and enjoy.... Plaza de Armas is the place to go to when in Cusco to relax, stroll, and people watch. Restaurants surround the square in all directions. Prices are tailored to tourists and all are almost the same within 10 to 15 soles. Try to explore the area even when on a right schedule...the area is safe. My hotel was about 10 blocks away from the plaza and it was nice to walk back and see new sights along the way.

Can't Miss in Cusco. The Plaza is the center of everything for Cusco and something that you will end up visiting frequently. There are churches, statues, fountains, and you'll probably see at least 1 parade while you are there. Be aware that this is the tourist hub for the city, so prices are higher, negotiations are less flexible, and the exchange rate isn't as good. Need a Starbucks for a coffee break? There is 1 on the 2nd floor on the South end of the Plaza with decent Wifi Speeds.

Excellent waypoint. Familiarize yourself with this spot while in Cusco because everything is close and relative to it. It's also a great place to catch a scheduled, but unknown, parade or cultural event. Also great for sightseeing and people watching. This place is picturesque at night as well.
City Center. This is a fun place with lots of restaurants and music in the city Center. Lots of shopping (but would find cheaper souvenirs off the beaten path)

Lots of Teenagers at Night. We went to the square in the evening and could not believe how many teens were out and about. Many of which were playing Pokemon! The next day we got up early in the morning and this was quite pleasant. Photos were great at this time of day. There were some traditional dances that were setting up a stage for performances later in the day.

Beautiful Square. This is a must visit in Cuzco. It has lovely gardens and is surrounded by beautiful Colonial buildings. There also happen to be lots of parades in Cuzco and they go through here. We saw parades here two days in a row.

Be prepared to take lots of photos.. This was a fantastic place. Lots to see. The architecture here is magnificent. We were there on a day where there were parades and people everywhere. It was quite a sight. Make sure you find one of the locals with an alpaca. They are hard to miss. All dressed up in many colors and carrying around a baby alpaca. You can get a photo with them for a couple soles. Really cool place. Also, See it at night too.

Interesting, but street vendors don't leave you alone for a second. We spent an hour in the plaza, with a constant barrage of locals selling art / shoe shines / jewelry - souvenirs / tours / massages / photo ops with alpaca - I spent the entire time shaking my head and saying "no gracias". But then that's true of the whole of Cusco. I get that tourists are their main source of income - it was a little tiresome though. Pretty square - just be prepared for some harassment.

Lovely place on a sunny day. It's a lovely place to just sit down relax and observe the atmosphere and movement around you. If you are lucky like I was and spend the week of Fiestas Patrias, (independence week) the place has lots of colour and parades and music every day...it was really nice. Ink a grill restaurant is just in front and I highly recommend it.
Amazing Cusco. A beautiful square jam packed with shops and nice restaurants although the vendors walking around can be annoying.
The main plaza. Very touristy, locals will try to sell you massages or art but besides that it's a nice area. Pretty Americanized but wishing 5 blocks you can find great local food.

Great locations but harassment from street vendors. This is a great location to stay and visit in Cusco, but there are tons of independent street vendors that constantly harass you to buy their trinkets and come in for a massage or whatever. The location has a lot of great tourist activities and restaurants and it seems to be the center for marching band competitions.
Beautiful and something always going on. We stayed in Cusco one week and visited the square every day. It is very pretty and many things to see.

Constantly harassed by locals wearing tradti. The Plaza de Armas is a nice place to stroll around as there's lots of beautiful buildings and museums. However, I was sick of constantly being harassed by locals wanting to sell me stuff. The worst were the women dressed up in traditional Inca clothing asking me to take their pictures (of course, they expect you to pay them to take their photos). I had already spent several days in the ancient Inca town, Ollantaytambo, where many locals wear the traditional clothing as their everyday clothing and I got many photos of that. The touristy ones in Cuzco were a bit over the top with their outfits, as many of them were holding lambs with bows around their necks. Come on. It was too much. I had no interest in taking touristy Inca photos and so I constantly refused to take their photos. One woman was so bold as to actually stand in front of my camera while I was trying to take a photo of one of the churches. I had to move my camera away from her and wait for her to move so that I could get the shot of the church. And then there's 'artists' who are all of the place trying to sell you their art. One guy told me that it was all his artwork, but I noticed that the styles were pretty different only to look at the artist signatures, which were different. That's when I noticed many of these sorts of guys around the city selling these sorts of artwork.
A must when in Cusco!. This is one of the heartbeats of Cusco!!! There is history on every corner, culture at your fingertips and a very cool Peruvian vibe!!!
Great View. Specially at night, great restaurant nearby. Nice Pictures scene. Cultural events seen. Great place to be

Great plaza, not much to see. The plaza is big, you have some churches and oftentimes there are celebrations in there since there is so much place, but at times you may see it only as a pass-through place to other sites in the city.
Beautiful. Great place for sightseeing. Shopping and dining. Visit the cathedrals and take a cute picture with Alpacas. Walk to everything. Beautiful landscape.

Fun, lots to see. We happened upon a festival of dance and catholic religion that had hundreds of dancers and musicians in traditional dress from many regions around Cusco. It went on for hours. It was colorful and just amazing. There are lots of restaurants, shops and good people watching at the Plaza. Highly recommend. Always something unexpected going on

Busy busy busy! . So we stayed in Cusco for 5 nights and everyday there was some kind of festivities at the Plaza de Armas. Not sure what they all were but lots of dancers, musicians and people in very interesting costumes! One day there was a military parade, another day it seemed it was a parade for the deceased. Anyway, everywhere around that place are shops that sell either cheap Peruvian souvenirs or expensive alpaca clothes. Then there's the 1000 women trying to sell you a $5 massage or pedicure. It gets annoying after a few days.

Beautiful day or night. This is the heart of Cusco and the centre of all the action, day or night. There seem to be frequent parades and events held in the square making it doubly interesting to visit.I enjoyed sitting on one of the many benches drinking water and people watching.A must site to visit when in Cusco with many local restaurants to choose from, so please ignore all the fast-food chain outlets creeping in, unfortunately.

The epicenter of Cusco. Yeah, there are tons of tourists here, of course, it's Cusco. Still, there's a reason why folks come here, it's the heart of a lovely town with lots to see and do. The Plaza is right in the heart of things...with plenty of historical sights and restaurants/shops at hand. No need for a guided tour, just get out and start walking...there's no doubt you'll stumble across your own Cusco! Day or night the Plaza de Armas will serve as a great starting point!

Busy, busy, busy. The Plaza De Armas is a very central and busy location in the heart of Cuzco. This is where all the tourists go for their shopping needs and to people watch. I spent some time there people watching and had a blast. You can get almost everything there from tattoos, coffee, alpaca garb, touristy stuff, clothing, dates, shoes, massages, shawls...etc. This is the central hub for all day hangouts and in the evenings is very crowded with people all ages, gender and ethnicity.

Plaza De Armas. You have to visit the Plaza...everyone goes here and you just really can see all the different people share space. Be it tourist or locals everyone just gets along and has a great time sharing energy.
Beautiful square. The hub of Cusco surrounded by lovely cathedrals and restaurants. Stay close to Plaza de Armas and you can reach most places by foot.

Nice square with lots of options. Nice square with lots of options of activities. The Cathedral is right in front of it and the Company of Jesus Church, as well as many little shops, restaurants, and bars.
You'll find one of these in just about every city in South America. Central gathering place. You will always find something to see and eat near or in the Plaza de Aramas
Beautiful and Quaint. Reminded me of italy and armenia- such a cozy little town with incredible food and historic sites. Would definitely stay in this city again!

Worth a look around. Right in the heart of Cusco the Plaza de Armas is one of the most scenic spots in the city. It always seems busy and filled with tourists. There is a strong police presence that makes it feel a bit safer. However, you will get hassled for a massage or to buy some tourist tat.

La Plaza. La Plaza is the locals and tourist hang out. I recommend booking a tour guide to learn about Cuzco. There are some free tours offered by locals however they take donations. They do a great job explaining about the history behind this Unesco site.

Heart of the city . This is the heart of the city it seems! There is plenty to do and even more to eat, plenty of popular places are around and the historic churches are a site to see! The only downside is the persistence of people to sell you items that range from massages, clothes, and photos. Besides that the place is excellent!
Just a plaza . Plaza de armas only offers you the sight seeing of the cathedral and and a good reference to go shopping or looking for restaurants. Nothing else!
main square mingles locals and tourists. local shops,restaurants, a bar and even a Starbucks coffee ta up space in this charming space. a wonderful blend of chic and baroque styles
Beautiful place. Plaza de Armas is charming and full of life. From the busy taxis and the many restaurants it is bursting with culture and charm.

Beautiful place, shame is now full of pokemon players :(. Awesome square with the cathedral, church, terraces, bars and all the history. However is hard to take a picture without having literally hundreds of Pokemon players looking down to their phones.
Easy to walk through with multitude of bars, shops, restaurants, etc..

Activie and charming. A lovely main square for the city that was once the center of Inca civilization. Lots of activities, restaurants and shopping opportunities populate the historic and vibrant space.

Beautiful. A great place to watch and enjoy the many traditions and beautiful architecture that this plaza has to offer! I loved the buildings and the way the old houses had been converted into restaurants, shops and museums but still keeping the old structures. The best thing is that the 3 American chain restaurants here are hidden within the old buildings so they are not in your face, you have to search in order to find them.

Spontaneous Parade Made This Interesting. The plaza is interesting, but no more so than many other similar plazas. However, there are regular celebrations and parades that pass through here, and that was fun to watch.
People Watch / Eat / shop. Stop by the church, see the interesting people, stop by one of the many good restaurants after a long day of hiking around ruins. Some good places to shop. Very nice.

Bustling city center. Beautiful square surrounded by restaurants and churches. I highly recommend grabbing a balcony seat at any restaurant, ordering some cafe con leches or beers while watching all the people and dogs in the square

Incredible square!. Plaza de Armas in Cusco is a beautiful square with interesting sights to see and things to do. The square is surrounded by amazing historical buildings, shops and restaurants. The attached picture was taken from a bar, on the square, located on the second floor. This gave a very nice view over the square, particularly on a sunny day accompanied by an ice-cold Cusceña beer! Plaza de Armas is hard to miss while visiting Cusco, Peru!
A lot going on. Nice place to people watch while visiting. There is a lot going on in the plaza and centrally located. Easy walk from our hotel and felt safe on our walk.

The main meeting point in Cuzco. It's a lovely square with many points of interest, but if you don't feel like visiting churches or museums, just sit on one of the benches, near local people and enjoy the city...
Central meeting area with shops surrounding . . Beautiful square , surrounded by restaurants , shops, and churches.street vendors sell all types of souvenirs from art work to jewelry in the square .

This is there happening place in Cusco. I would have your taxi drop you off here and spend a day or two. Tons of great merch and super cheap if you barter. Great restaurants too. Be prepared for lots of vendors to come up to you.

Beautiful city center with lots of history. What used to be the capital of many South American countries, now serves as a beautiful city center for Cusco. Filled with lots of history and hidden paths, it's a great place to explore when you're in town.
Average town plaza. Pretty average town plaza surrounded by stores and eateries and populated by vendors, students, lovers, buds dogs and an occasional acrobat.

Center of Cusco; always busy. Even apart form the Pokemon Go players, the plaza was always busy and friendly. Worth the visit. some touristy stores around it that nonetheless have some interesting items. When we visited during a festival there were many locals that made the square very festive and lively.

The Beating Heart of Cuzco. We stayed in Cuzco for three days as part of acclimating to the altitude for and prior to our Inca Trail trek. The Plaza combines aspects of both Colonial and Inca history and architecture ... it is also a place to people watch and where frequent entertainment takes place. The two principal Cathedrals are located on the square as are numerous eateries, shops and museums ...
great. the entrance to the church is very comfortable you only need to pay 10 soles i recommended to take a tour of a travel agency is cheaper

Beautiful view from the plaza. . There are multiple sites to see around the plaza including 2 cathedrals. However, be prepared to say "No gracious" because there are a lot of people selling everything from key chains to snacks to paintings. If your lucky enough to find a bench with some shade sit a while and people watch. For 1 soles you can have your picture taken with a Peruvian woman in traditional dress and a baby llama. Lot of restaurants around the plaza as well.

Wonderful. The Plaza De Armas is exactly what it sounds like. The plaza where once Cusco residents would take shelter and protection from any advancing armed force. Today it's a beautiful and tranquil location to breath in the beauty of this resplendent city. Surrounded by shopping, cathedrals, resteraunts and hotels it offers much to any visitor!

Feels like Bangkok... It looks nice, sure! But every single person there seems to try to sell you something. Massages, tours, paintings, drugs, you get offered everything. There are many nicer places in Cusco!

Central and Lively always.. Plaza de Armas..the HEART of Cusco has everything built around it. Everything emanates from there. Food...shops..tourist offices....Irish Pub lol....churches....buildings...It has them all and so much more. Sit on the steps and watch the World go by. Enjoy the school children dancing ans the music playing. Avoid the Global conglomerates that have invaded the square.....connect with the heart-beat of Peru as a launching site to many. many attractions. We based ourselves there for a week and used Cusco as a base...It worked well. At night the Plaza is lovely.... music in the bars...whatever you fancy!
Nice. The plaza was a relaxing place to visit and feed pigeons. We sat on the benches every day of our stay. There are vendors, restaurants, and architectural beauty nearby.

Key place to visit in Cusco city. The Plaza is the main attraction in Cusco city center and it is a little historical square with nice little shops and restaurants in the little alleyways around the square. A must visit if visiting Cusco, even for 30 minutes.
Good plaza. Nothing too special here, but a nice peaceful spot to rest and people watch if you have some extra time. You'll likely walk through here on your way someplace else anyway.
Magic - Plaza de Armas. It is hard not to love this place. I come from Lima, and every time I go to Cusco, I fall in love again with this place. Fantastic place!

A Peaceful Oasis. The Plaza has some busy roads around it but once you reach the Plaza, it is a lovely, peaceful oasis. It is like a park with a central fountain and intersecting pedestrian only walkways. There are also lovely flowerbeds and plenty of seats to sit and enjoy the scenery. The cathedral and main churches surround the plaza and these have wonderful architecture, you can also see the mountains in the distance, so all the views are great.
Must see in Cusco. Took [pics by the fountain and found it to be a charming part of Cusco. Well worth the visit and close to shopping and food.
very memorible. Just got back from there and this is a great spot to meet friends, watch local celebrations and parades, great bars and restaurants, very beautiful.

There is always something going on!. We did not have a ton of time in Cusco but simply hanging out at the Plaza de Armas was incredible. Seeing parades of dancers (unexpected) and the Santa Rosa Festival was a highlight on our last day. Take in a coffee shop or Calle del Medio restaurant on the top floor over looking the Plaza for the best views!
Peru vacation. The heart of historic Cuzco, full of great restaurants and souvenir shops. A great central location from which to explore the city's museums and churches.

The centre of Cuzco. You can't really miss this main square if you are staying in Cuzco. It's clean, friendly and has lots of shops and restaurants around the edge - go for a drink in a restaurant with a balcony for a great view. It's very central and so you can find other main attractions and roads easily.
Gorgeous Square in Cusco. Your first views will take your breath away. It is vibrant and surrounded by gorgeous architecture. I would not miss this if you are fortunate enough to visit Cusco.

Plaza de Armas in Cusco was Beautiful!. Plaza de Armas was a beautiful plaza. I've been to so many, and this one was one of my favorites, especially at night! During the day it was always crowded, but at night it was peaceful and the lights were beautifully done! Like many Plaza's there are shops and restaurants around and of course the annoying merchants. I learned not to walk near the shops, just walk on the roads, they were blocked from cars. Restaurant wise, I found local places tucked behind the plaza away from the touristy places. There seemed to always be something going on here, I would recommend checking out the cathedrals that famously face Plaza de Armas. I feel, this is the area you end up at a few times a day.
pretty at night. This is a bustling area of town. Lots of people to watch. Pleasant place to sit in the evenings. The buildings are lit nicely.
Great people watching and nice vibe. Sit back on a bench and watch the local Peruvians go by. It's clean, very attractive, and surrounded by lovely churches to visit.

One of the most beautiful squares I have ever seen! And I am from Italy!. During the day the colors...the fresh air...especially when we were there...end of July - mid August was incredible! Look for Maria...she has the best prices and most truthful smile while selling the carved seeds.
Peaceful place. Very peaceful place although there are people walking around everywhere. Magnifient buildings and structures. Good place to soak up the sunshine.
Center of cusco and tourism area center. This is the epicenter of good hotels, retaurants, bars and boutique shops; plus has the cathedral which is very popular.
Bustling Centre of Town. A hive of activity, you can find everything you need around this square. Remember to try Restaurant Limo. The occasional concerts are also held here.
Center of tourism and commerce. A very busy place, where you will find historical tourist attractions, restaurants and shops. Also many tour buses depart from places around this square.
Cute. Nice safe square. There were a lot of locals trying sell stuff but they don't bombard you. Lots of restaurants to chose from and shopping is nice as well.
Center of Cusco. The Plaza de Armas feels like the heart of Cusco, with so much to catch your eye. It's the perfect spot to wander from and see what Cusco has to offer.

FULL OF HISTORY AND INTERESTING THINGS. Plaza de Armas has many historical buildings in the area as well as interesting shops and restaurants. The only negative thing is you will be accosted by a myriad of street vendors. However this is a must see area.

Great bath in the local crowd. At my last visit to Cusco, I visited the plaza several times. I enjoyed the hundreds of local teens who spent time there. Also, around he plaza are many high end restaurants. The plaza is extremely pretty at night.
Beautiful. That is the central plaza and you have to pass by bucause it is a central place at the historical district! It is very beautiful!
Nice stroll all day. Has a lot of restaurants and clubs around . Nice place to take a walk around it. Very convenient location if you are staying near plaza. Check out chocolate museum
Great spot. Great spot to go after arriving in Cusco while adjusting to the altitude. Sit down and take it easy while enjoying the people watching or grabbing a bite to eat. Lots to see here.

Great centre for Cusco tourists. Great plaza with loads of restaurants and bars to relax, dine and enjoy Cusco from! I love how every shop/brand has to blend in with the old colonial/incan theme. Beautiful and full of history.
Majestic. Very big and open this is a majestic plaza, where even Mac Donald's and Starbuck's are in beautiful buildings. The arcades are fabulous.

very lively, especially late afternoon. top of the world sensation, with historic buildings all around and distant views of mountains. Lots of tourist police, so watch out for scams. We encountered a classic shoe cleaner scam. Some live music.Great for people watching. Inevitably lots of tourists
Average city center. There are some shops, churches, and restaurants. Nothing incredibly exciting about it. It's worth taking a look at, but once you've seen it there's not a big reason to go back.

Vibrant. Large plaza with an inca statue in the centre. The best feature is that it is vehicle free most of the time. Crossing the traffic to get there is a challenge. On our visits it was always busy and vibrant. Some groups doing protest or celebrating something made it even more interesting. Seemed to be lots of dogs roaming and when they formed packs it was unsettling. Lots of tourist sellers in the plaza. Good idea to find a balcony and watch the people during lunch or over a drink. Seemed safe.

So pretty, especially at night. This is a lively spot during all hours of the day. I loved it in the evening once it was all lit up and people were running around to get to a bar, restaurant, home, wherever. I loved seeing the lights from houses that are built on the surrounding mountains of Cusco. Definitely a great place to walk around after supper or sit on a bench and watch people be. If you're there during the day - make sure to have food for all of the pigeons!

Loved Plaza De Armas. Lots of places to stay, eat, see, and book tours. Tours are easily booked here in Plaza De Armas. Lots of things to enjoy. Just watch out for the ladies with the Alpaca. The walk up to you and offer you to pet their alpaca and offer you to take a picture then afterwards say it is 20 soles for you letting and taking a picture. They do not mention this when they walk up to you, and theres armed military soldiers all over you are afraid to cause a scene by saying no, so you feel obligated to pay. So watch out for them and ask ahead od time if they are going to charge you to pet and take a picture.

Festive and Active. Always vibrant. The night of our arrival a concert with hundreds of people was hosted. Lights, energy - so much positive all around!A lot of security present - appeared to be very organized.

Wonderful stores and great architecture. We spent most of our time in the Plaza eating and shopping. There are some beautiful silver stores as well as tourist shops and upscale shops for the locals. Fabulous restaurants (MAP Cafe, Fallen Angel).
the main square in Cusco. this is the hub of Cusco with all the shops and restaurants around it. Safe even at night. Would recommend buying good here not at the markets.

Lively beautiful square. An awesome place to hangout, have an ice-cream, take pictures, stroll and watch people, also vet hustled by the souvenir sellers. It does get crowded in the evenings. We were there right before an event where a stage and lights were set up. It looked amazing. It is the place to meet for city walking tours.

Beautiful central square. Thankfully traffic is not allowed on 3 of the 4 sides of the amazing square. Flanked by 2 churches/cathedrals and colonial buildings, it is a beautiful place to behold. Also great just to sit on a bench and contemplate.

A Must See in Cusco. The Plaza de Armas is GORGEOUS. It is surrounded by centuries old building, cathedrals, and cobble stone streets and in the center is the beautiful park with a wonderfully detailed fountain. The Plaza is lively at all hours of the day, well guarded by police, and has plenty of restaurants, shops, and bars.The BIG problem is the overwhelming amount of hyper-egressive street vendors trying to peddle their junk to you. They will literally follow you for blocks trying to sell you massages, over priced tours, cheap looking paintings, or mass produced 'authentic' alpaca hats.Word to the wise DO NOT book a trip with ANY of the tour operators here or you will get ripped off.

Hustle and bustle of Cusco. Good to start off your Cusco trip, lots of attractions near by, souvenirs and tickets for everything can be bought here. Lots of shops and places to eat. Even saw local bands, dances here.

Well kept, beautiful on a nice day. The grass on the Plaza is incredibly well kept, and is lovely to walk through. It feels safe at night as well, and there's great views of it from the Papacho's burger restaurant. The cathedrals are beautiful as well, and is a great 'first thing' to see when visiting Cusco

History Preserved. Every City in Perú has its own Plaza de Armas, however this particular one is absolutely amazing. The historical buildings are pretty radical to see. This is a definite place to see and the center of everything in Cuzco, so basically you are forced to come here in a way. Come and see the beautiful Spanish architecture, you will not be disappointed!
Beautiful Downtown. It is amazing/ Clean beautiful. Full of activities. Saw children dancing . Also saw a procession for La Virgen del Carmen with a full band.

The Heart of the City. The Plaza de Armas was once a swamp according to our guide. It dried up during the Inca time and was later used as an administrative, religious and cultural center. Now, it is the core of modern Cusco with all the restaurants, shopping galore, tourist operators and of course the main attraction, the cathedral and the Juisuits buildings. They make up the most attention in the entire plaza. The two names Huacaypata and Cusipata both have symbolic symbol and these places were places where ceremonies took place. The plaza is enormous. It is a place to sit, relax, watch people, feed the doves, pose for selfies and relax. Hire a guide who can explain a lot of these. Then a journal to write them down.
Cusco. Fabulous! Fountain wasn't working but still lovely! The park was full as it was a national holiday. Everyone friendly and in a happy mood!
Very interesting. Always something going on. Sundays seem to be more crowded and parades tend to occur. Plenty of police in area so we always felt safe.
Plaza de Armas. It is amazing place to visit, you can find a lot of historical sites, like cathedrals and fountain. Also a lot of shops for shopping, but be careful of the pick pockets.

Fantasitic Plaza. This is a huge Plaza with one cathedral and one huge church.It is one of the best places in Peru to people watch (in good weather). The park police can be a bit whistly but they do keep the incessant sales people of Cusco at bay! On top of all the restaurants there is also a MaccyDs which may suit backpackers who want a change from local food!!!
Where the crowds are.... Beautiful plaza. Lots of great Peruvian restaurants, even an American KFC here. Great shops, locally made artisan breads and so much more
lots happening here. nice area to spend time. usually something happening like parade or something. nice restaurants and cafes around the place and the history of the place is awesome

A FINE WALK ON THE SQUARE. The square takes you back in time. With two cathedrals, a fountain with an Inka king at a statue, the place is full of people day or night. Lots of shops and restaurants around as well.
Lovely Place. Love this plaza and it's beautiful in the evening, too. Great place to sit and read a book, to walk around, and for photos.

One of the most beautiful square in all of Peru. This is a gorgeous square with the church and all the surroundings. Even with the new store fronts, you can picture what it must of looks like 300 years ago. The city is much busier than it used to be, but there is still a certain charm.
Busy area in the middle of cusco. THis is a busy plaza with lots going on, from vendors to kids practicing performances to band performances to restaurants.

Surprisingly Festive. Cusco, being a distance away from the capital LIMA, i had expected the Plaza to be pretty pedestrian. But I was pleasantly surprised. There were bustling locals, tourists, from backpackers to families all milling around, souvenir shopping, or deciding where and what to eat.The centre has many souvenir shops and almost all are able to exchange forex.Plaza de Armas had a wonderful vibe about it and I was disappointed that I had not got an opportunity to experience at night.

Beautiful. A must-see while in Cusco. The Plaza de Armas is a central location for many local activities in Cusco, and if you visit in July during their Independence month, you can see many colorful parades.
Busy place. It is a beautiful plaza, but watch your belongings and be prepared to be pounced upon by people wanting to sell you things. A friendly "no gracias" usually works if you're not interested.

Charming Main Square. There is lots to see and do in this main plaza! Lots of restaurants, shops, big cathedrals, beautiful water fountain, and just a lot of hustle and bustle all around! Definitely a must do if you're in Cusco! It's such a small little town, it's nice to explore their culture!
Cusco Vacation. A good place to see a lot of different things. Remember the street vendors expect to haggle. Always try before you pay.
Worth to visit. I visited this place when I was in Cusco. I'd recommend to spend some times in Plaza de Armas specially nighttime.
BEAUTIFUL. Loved it. Very charming, especially at night. It is beautiful and safe. Lots of shopping and restaurants.

Cusco never sleeps. You sit up on stair and watch the busy plaza.All day long a very,very busy town.During the day they closing the plaze for all turists,you don't have to worry about traffic.Convinient location for all eateries,shopping travel agents around the plaza.Yep,safe place to be.

Beautiful plaza & nice spot for people watching!. Plaza de Armas is a massive plaza in the heart of the historic center of Cusco. It is a very popular spot for locals and tourists alike and is a good place to relax, soak up the sun and watch the world go by. Many photo opportunities!

Must see. This is a must it is in the heart of Cusco good place to people watch.Look out for stray dogs but location clean beautiful in the night. lot of food locations and shops near by to buy gifts for friends and family.You might me lucky to see someone wedding they take a lot of pics here for the beautiful background.

Loved this site to people watch and enjoy the local parade!. Busy plaza with the cathedrals, museum, restaurants, hotels all within a very short walk. Safe day and night. (Only annoyance was the persistent offer for massages.)The local school parade with group after group of young children dressed in a variety of traditional clothing performing different dances was an unexpected treat the day we were there! We ate dinner at the Braza Brava which had a table for two overlooking the plaza - perfect end to a perfect trip!

great views, many restaurants and shops. this central plaza is a must-see for any tourist in cusco. there were nightly dances in the square during my visit, and the square features a beautiful cathedral and central statue, great views of the surrounding mountains, as well as many restaurants and shops around the plaza.

Parade taking place. I happened to visit one of the days of the celebration of 195 years away from the Spaniards was taking place. It was interesting to hear all parade participants sing the same song.

Beautiful square. This place is picturesque. I love seeing the Andes mountains in the background. You'll have a few hundred people asking you if you want a tour to Machu Picchu or a massage, which is annoying but understandable.
Heart of Cusco. Always something to see, you could spend all day watching the world go by from here. Surrounded by museums, shops and great restaurants.

Magnificent Plaza. Loved the grand size of Cusco's Plaza de Armas.
We thoroughly enjoyed our time in the plaza just watching daily life.
The plaza is a pedestrian free area which can be refreshing in the hustle bustle of Cusco.
We were able to walk to the area from our hotel on Calle San Agustin.
The large cathedral is a must see.
Gorgeous area !. We seriously wanted to stay in Cusco much longer. Our visit here was incredible. The statue fountain was very beautiful.

It's one of the prettiest plazas I've seen. I just love Cusco's plaza de armas. It's gorgeous, full of life, I never get tired of it. There are restaurants and coffee places with balconies facing the plaza, it's a pleasure to just sit and enjoy.

Fun, safe, shopping, food,bars . Very comfortable !!!!!!
Always a local activity going on.
Very safe !!!!!
Lots if fun !!!!
A couple historical cathedrals
Spend an extra day.
Beautiful City Center. This is a great place to relax, people watch and enjoy the beauty of the city center. There are many shops and restaurants near by, even a Starbucks.
Good. Great night time outing, you will appreciated better at night time that during the date, the lights and the night activities, great for pictures and to explore.
Visit and apreciate!. The center f the city, is amazing to discovery the space and understand your localization. People from worldwide will be there.

Great spot for photos. Surrounded by cute places to eat and buy souvenirs, this is a lively central focus to Cusco. Take a camera as there are some beautiful buildings and adorable lambs wearing colorful wooly hats!
Beautiful central plaza in Cusco. If you stay near the Plaza you will be in easy walking distance to lots of great restaurants at all price points, shopping, and sightseeing.
City Center Hang out. I love how this area has a lot to offer as far as restaurants, night life, souvenir shops etc. So many choices so little time!
Lovely. A little crowded but very vibrant and beautiful, there are a lot of restaurants nearby and so many things to do in order to have a good time and enjoy the Peruvian culture which is amazing!

Another Plaza de Armas. Every town seems to have a square called "Plaza de Armas" ( literally Weapons Square, but better translated as Parade Square or parade ground). We had a relaxing couple of hours here on a beautiful day watching a huge colourful parade around the Plaza.

A lot of action happens here. We saw a Peru independence celebration here. The place has a lovely fountain with male mermaids. The plaza is a gathering place for natives and tourists and hawkers alike--old and young. The plaza is surrounded by restaurants, cathedrals, and shops.
Cusco's heart. The hub of Cusco. A lot of tourists visit here at various times of the day for the beauty of the plaza itself and the surrounding attractions including the Cathedral and restaurants.

excellent. learned alot about there history had a well informed driver (jhonathan napuri arroyo )
when you are in lima call 992001498 peru has alot to offer plaza de armas has beautiful buildings and it has a changing of the guards at noon WOW

Nice to look at. Plaza de Armas in Cusco is similar to Plaza de Armas in Lima on a smaller scale. Nice to sit and people watch as you sip some coffee on a chilly winter night. It was great to see the Plaza de Armas completely packed with people the day before the Winter Solstice celebration.

Amazing June Festivities. I was in Cusco during June and was amazed by the festivities that were occurring in and near the Plaza. Music and colourful outfits filled the Plaza. There were also two Peruvian ladies in colourful outfits with a lamb offering photo ops for two soles.The Catedral Basilica is one of two churches in the Plaza and is definitely worth a visit for the impressive interior. There are also several restaurants and shops around the Plaza.

Very nice plaza interact with people.. As far as plazas goes they are just squares... with a statue and a Church. But as a part of the big picture is very nice to see shoe shining services, sellers, tour guides the church and vibrant Cusco. more than a square is social and cultural vibe. So more than the place interact with the people to get the joy of it.

Very nice place. Plaza de Armas is a very nice park, very clean, locals there are really kind and patient if you need some help. Probably the only problem is the sellers, they drove me crazy by offering me tours even tho I said no like 4 times.
touristic central point of Cusco. Not to miss.. the very center of the old town of Cusco. Try to find a hotel nearby so you can easily walk around town
Pretty square to visit. Does what it says on the tin! Nice square to walk around and sit at during the day. Lots of shops and places to eat close by too.

Plaza de Armas to start. Start your time in Cusco at Plaza de Armas and get a good feel for the center of the Incan empire as well as the Spanish Colonial changes. Use this as the jumping off point to wander through the areas with ancient Incan engineering.

Great Plaza, GREAT .... D O G S !. What you may think flying in the wind is the Rainbow pride flag, is really the flag of Tahuantinsuyo (representing the entire Inca empire.) This flies with the Peruvian red & white flag in the heart of the square. the Plaza is amazingly clean. Beautiful cathedrals & churches abound, but something unexpected was..... the dogs. Lots of them. And not the 3-legged, scary, scabby-beat-up-homeless type. But the longer haired (it gets cold in Cusco) gorgeous, overly friendly type. My kids had a whole crew (pack) running with us for 3 days straight. The dogs were well behaved, and .... fun. Like fetch a water bottle and bring it back, roll on your back, etc. etc. We found this to be common throughout the country, but specifically in Cusco. Felt the plaza was a bit more enjoyable at night over a hot Coca tea, but in day time was also worth a visit.

Charming . Great place to walk around and gather the much needed breath whilst adjusting to the altitude have a coffee in the side streets and take some coins with for the locals, it's sometimes the only money they make. Have a photo with one and what ever animals is on display. Enjoy all the dogs running around.

A lovely Plaza and a delightful setting. This ancient plaza dates back to Inca times, and history oozes out of every corner. Surrounded by colonial arcades, the imposing cathedral dominates the Northern side, with the hills of Cusco behind. A fountain in the middle of the Plaza completes the scene. A lovely place, which all travellers to Cusco will enjoy.

Active square. This square sits in the middle of historic Cusco with 2 churches, multiple restaurants and shops surrounding it. On Sundays, there are usually large gatherings and parades, which you can watch from 2nd floor restaurants.

My favorite Plaza!. I've been to Chile, Argentina, and Bolivia so far in my 10 month travels and this is by far my favorite Plaza de Armas in all South America so far. Great wide open spaces, beautiful backgrounds and great for people watching. Don't miss!

lovely place. the plaza de armas is such a lovely visit, the view is wonderful and is so wide and the architecture is so nice, you can spend an entire afternoon sitting there and admiring the view. the plaza is full of life , day and night. Is a great place to hang out.

Another nice square. Just as you can overdose on churches you can get to many Plaza de Armas into your system. This is a flat square with a little garden, a nice foundation ( topped with a indigenous leader), some grass and some benches. In that way an ideal meeting places, but no a sight on it's own.
Clean and not too "touristy". There are many good restaurants around the Plaza, but the best time to go is on Sundays when various chefs cook local cuisine from 8:00-3:00
Beautiful to walk around. great restaurants and shopping.. Cusco is a great city. Safe to stroll. Very historical. Read Fodor's Travel and Travel Smart Peru before I went.
Postcard Moment. All the plazas in Cusco were beautiful. This plaza was full of life day and night. The photo opportunities are the best.
Beautiful Plaza. It's a big, wide, open space that was never crowded when I was there. I could use some more trees for shade.

Well utilized city park. The Plaza is filled with people day and night. Lots of people walking their dogs (and lambs), clowns running down the pedestrian street, a children's foot race, street vendors, etc. A vibrant city park at 11000 feet!
Worth a visit!. By chance we were in Cusco at the time of their June festival which added to the enjoyment. Plenty to enjoy just walking around the centre.

A Constant Party in the Plaza!. We happened to be visiting during the late June festival, and the plaza was constantly covered with people in costumes and parades, it seemed like the parade went on for a week, during the entire time we were there! It was fun!

Beautiful gardens and huge Incan statue. The plaza is well kept and clean. One very appreciated aspect is that steer vendors are discouraged selling their products in the plaza. The statue of the Incan King is impressive

Beautiful. Great people watching and if you go during June there are parades and festivals almost every night. The locals celebrate the Winter Solstice and the sun. There are some great shops, try Limo if you are hungry for dinner and be sure to try a Pisco Sour there too. There is also a great chocolate shop.

Gotta see in Cuzco . You gotta see the Plaza de Armas in Cuzco. Honestly, there is no way you can physically miss it, unless you fly in and immediately begin your trek to the Sacred Valley. Find a bench, people watch, and enjoy an afternoon break in the Plaza. You won't be disappointed.

Impressive and beautiful . The plaza de armas is the center of the city. Is a vibrant place with many things going on. While we were here School groups were performing and children were running and laughing.
Plaza is ringed with historical churches shops and restaurants

The center of Cusco. The plaza is filled with so much history, culture and energy, it's amazing! The sunset views of Cusco city are spectacular and at night, when everything is lit up, it feels like you're in another world!!!! I visited in June 2016, it was sunny and cold during the day and chilly at night. The city was preparing for the Corpus Christi festival, so there was a lot of dancing (kids and adults), bands performing and lots of activity. It's very nice to stroll through at night time.

The tourist center of Cusco. We stayed at a hostel half a block from the Plaza de Armas for our Machu Picchu trip. The Plaza is the center of tourist activity in Cusco and is ALWAYS bustling with activity. There are dancers in the street, peddlers, and it's hard to walk down any part of the street without numerous vendors trying to get your attention to buy trinkets, tours, or dining. it is a little overwhelming and the noise goes late into the night. However, it was nice to have a very central area with no cars - we ate all our meals within the Plaza de Armas. And the plaza itself is very beautiful with cobblestone streets (blocked to cars), a church, and a monastery. There is a McDonald's there when you need something American, and many restaurants, ATM machines, laundry services, etc. If you wantto avoid the noise, you should stay at least a block away from the plaza, but even then the music and drums will likely carry through the night.

Great for history and people watching. We were in town the day of Inti Raymi, the largest festival of the year. It did not take place at Plaza de Armas so it was not as crowded as it may have been. Holding a baby alpaca with the gorgeously and colorfully clothed native women and girls was certainly a highlight. Be sure to pay them at least 1 Sol.

Put on your To Do List. We hired Viajes Pacifico via VIATOR! To do a city tour! They were excellent as usual! This is a small square but very pitcuresque! Surrounded by beautiful old peruvian & spanish buildings - ( all stores or restaurants or tour or cambio places now) with a fantastic view of the mountains and Christ the Redeemer ! Its even more beautiful at night !
Beautiful area of the Cusco. We loved this area of Cusco. From the people selling local art to the fantastic food in the area this is a great place to travel.

Must see if you are in Cusco. Plaza de armas in Cusco is probably one of the most beautiful I have seen in South America, check it out! Also if you face towards Resbalosa street and walk the little street there you will have amazing views of the plaza de armas and the casco viejo

Cusco Adventure. Plaza De Armas is a small quaint plaza full of life and colorful festivals! Safe clean and vibrant with much history, museums and cathededrals. Plenty of eateries nearby from trendy and pricey to very reasonable localaly owned establishments, pubs and cafes as well.
People watching steps. When I was here there was the montocristi celebrations on the square and it was was alive with music happiness and colour. Nice place to hang out and people watch
Plaza . In the middle of the area and surrendered by great churches and restaurants! You can just sit around and admire the beautiful buildings or you can have a meal and just enjoy the sights!!!
Fascinating Plaza De Armas.. This place was colorful and quite interesting. Ornate Catholic Churches and buildings on the square. Fun touristy shops and restaurants.

beautiful. It is a very nice place at day and night. You have a lot of restaurantes for watch the view and take a good cusqueña beer and eat a wonderfull aji de gallina(chicken and cream), that is a very tipical dish over there.

central attractive square surrounded by varied attractions. The Plaza de Armas is a typical well laid out S American square with easy access from and to good pubs,hotels,restaurants,shops,museums, churches etc. certainly worth visiting both in its own right and for the surrounding attractions.

A must if you are in Cusco. I LOVED Cusco! Although I went in July and it was pretty cold, I absolutely loved this town, and being in the Plaza de Armas. There are a lot of children who come up to you selling things which you feel bad saying no to :(. It is also beautiful at night.
Nightlife amazing . We enjoyed practice dance and music for the Inti Raymi celebration. It was full of life at night with children and families.

Beautiful and historical . Scenic with great shopping and cusco's cathedral and the church of the society of Jesus sits right on the plaza. It is safe to walk there from most of the hotels in the area

Pretty square in the city center!. This square is the most popular in the old city center of Cusco. If you end up in Cusco in June (the festival month) you'll also be able to see many festivities taking places here (traditional dances, parades, etc). Ah, and if you are into knitwear and baby alpaca clothing, you'll find many nice shops here!
Breathtaking view from the center of Cusco!. Visited during the Inti Raymi festival in Cusco! Stunning views, enjoyable celebrations and interesting history.

June is awesome time to visit!. Cusco has its annual celebration all week prior to June 24. We saw a three-hour-long parade with lots of local color, saw a concert at night, and fireworks as well. It's a good time to go. The plaza is nice to visit even without the festivities. Nice feel, and lots of shops down the side streets.
Good visit. The local schools were having dancing festivals. It was very colurful and fun to watch. There are lots of police all over the city so you feel very secure walking around everywhere.
great place to walk and see the old city. This is a beautiful and historic square on par with any European square. Definitely a must see during your stay in Cusco.

Lots of fun at festival time. We were lucky that we visited at the midwinter festival time and for most of the time the Plaza was shut to traffic which made it very good for pedestrians. Each day we saw parades and one evening there was a rock concert and fireworks. We liked that when we looked around the square we could see the Andes mountains behind the buildings which framed them nicely. There could also be seen the houses further out in the suburbs. When we went the Cusco flags of rainbow colours were everywhere which made the Plaza very festive. There were plenty of police about but we did not see any trouble and felt very safe walking about.
Couldn't see it!. Unfortunately while we were visiting in Cusco, the fountain was covered up for the Inti Raymi festival.... but I'm sure it's beautiful!
Lively meeting place. This plaza was a lively meeting place in the centre of the city, very beautiful and safe for tourists.
Beautiful.. This place is just magical, it feels like you went back in time, Its colonial, cozy, full of life. You'll literally want to move there.(We did)Definitely coming back.

Lots to do!. So much going on in this main plaza! It is where all the hype is for sure. A lot of tours leave from here and a lot of great restaurants and pubs and shops etc run in the plaza too. Really nice pictures at night! We happened to be there over Christmas time and they had a HUGE market and decorations set up it was beautiful!

The Downtown Plaza. Cusco is called the naval or birth place of the Inca's. The Plaxa de Armas is the heart of the city. This plaza is surrounded by the churches, restaurants, money exchange, and shops. It is filled with people in the evening and day. Although the Catholic Churches are open to the public, they want you to buy tour tickets . I had seen several churches in Lima and did not pay to go into the churches here. Instead, I enjoyed walking around the area, looking at the shops, and talking to people that I met a the plaza.

Beautiful!!. The plaza is gorgeous!! It is also a wonderful place to sit and just people watch! There always seemed to be something happening. We were fortunately to be there for the Corpus Christi...that was just fascinating to watch!!
