Good to relax. Lots to watch as the world goes by. Sit down chill and relax. Nice square. Get there early if a festival is on and take something to sit on between you and cold stone.
A must if in Cuzco. Beautiful large plaza. Cafes with great views around the edges. Regular cultural activities. Especially on Sundays.
THE MAIN SQUARE. Is very nice with an inca arquitecture, my family and i enjoyed our stay in the city, specially to have time to share experiences with the cusquenian people..
Historic. Definitely a place to experience. We lucked out as it was the anniversary week of Cusco. Many places to see around the square.

Wonderful central plaza. This is a must see for anyone in Cusco, but look out as it has slowly evolved into a tourist trap. The plantings and giant statue in the center of multiple cathedrals are all beautiful. If you look at the surrounding buildings you will begin to notice Starbucks and KFC as well as many other touristy atractions to be avoided. Definitly worth a visit, but know that buisness interests are almost never culturally enriching.

Nice . Wonderful place to see with plenty of historical monuments, shops, bars and restaurants, things to do and to visit, or simply for hanging out after a day of trekking on high altitude. Definitely, a must see in Cuzco

Beautiful and historic!. Love this area. Feels like travelling back in time. Very picturesque. Lots of cosy cafes bars and restaurants nearby and lots of opportunity to pic up some warm and wonderful alpaca hats/ scarves etc.

Nice plaza to sit and people watch. We loved just walking around the plaza and then sitting a while to people watch. Great architecture to admire as well. There are also many shops and restaurants around the plaza.

Nice plaza, but certainly not the best of Cusco for me. The plaza is a nice place optically. It has no soul though as it is full of people begging and trying to sell massages, food, paintings, and other stuff. Every 20th step, someone approaches you for this reason. So, after a few minutes of taking in the sight, it becomes boring. For me, the areas above Cusco are amazing. The neighborhoods become very humble and the people nicer and less jaded against tourists. Overall though a pretty plaza.
Definitely a must place to see. Even if you don't like history and culture, you should at least pass by. Late afternoon is a good time as the sun is nit so hard on you by then.
Lucky to visit durning the festival. We spent almost everyday exploring the square during our 5 day stay. The architecture is breathtaking and the small streets are plentiful. A must see and do

Lovely place !!. In one corner you will find a restaurant called Meson de Espadas where you will find really delicious food. The whole square is surrounded by historic buildings. There are also restaurants and shops for every taste and pocket. We have visited Cuzco four times and would love to go again. A recommendation for wine - try to find Ocucaje Rosé - it is a surprisingly full-bodied wine and I found it to be the best I've ever tasted. Last visited May 2014.
Beautiful. This is such a beautiful place to visit! The building architecture is amazing and the people around make this a great place to sit and relax, or eat outside at a restaurant.

You'd think you were in Spain. Lovely plaza, somewhat marred by the omnipresent street vendors. Looks like what it is, a plaza built by the Spanish in colonial period with the requisite cathedral and City Hall. It was very pleasant to sit on the steps and watch the people. Some nice shopping, too.
Inti rayma celebration. How great to see the plaza with all the activity and Fiestas that entail this holiday. Hundreds fill the streets and there's much to see.
Walking around Cusco. There's great history there wit a lot of good shops and history. It was walking distance from our hotel so we spent time there when we could.
Center of Attention for Cusco. Wow! Cathedrals, parades, restaurants, shops, and lots of people are all around the Plaza de Armas! I would recommend going here. I never felt unsafe.

Wonderful Plaza with Regular Parades and Festivals. We loved the plaza square in Cusco. We stayed a block from it and spent time there every day. 2 of the 4 days we were there they had parades. There is always a lot of activity and great restaurants all around. It's beautiful at night.

Very cool historic area. The plaza is a great place to meet and a base camp for exploring all of the streets/shops around it. Very safe and clean. June is an amazing month to visit because of all the parades and activities.

See the Action here!. This is the main plaza in Cusco. Lots of people, local activities and festivals take place here. Lots of nice shops and restaurants in the area. A real must see to get the feel of the town and its people..

Lovely well-cared for public space. We were in Cusco at the same time as the Cusco Festival for 10 days of parades and dancers and terrific crowds of people. The plaza was beautifully landscaped and cared for. People avoided walking on the grass, as the signs suggested. Gardeners watered flowerbeds. And photographers sold portraits of people in front of the fountain, which was surrounded by an enclosure to make it look like an Incan structure. There was no litter on ground after days and days of tourists and families visiting the busy square.

Beautiful Square. This was a beautiful square with lots going on the when we were there. It was Corpus Cristi so lots of people in the evening with bands, floats, and lots of people. We enjoyed people watching from the Plaza de Armas Restaurant which has a great balcony overlooking the square.

Really nice plaza, center for all tourism. Centre for all the celebrations in June. All the days during the week we were, groups of children were training for dancing they will do in a parade end of June. Cathedral and church really wonderful, built in XVI century. They are a must, but for sure every tourist will pass around this plaza.Avoid this place looking for good price restaurants or pubs

Festival fun to watch . We were here when they were hosting a festival (I think an Inkan one in worship of the sun god, but I may be wrong). Very pretty and worth visiting. Lovely churches and lots of restaurants nearby.

Central plaza of Cuszo. This is the central square of Cusco. On week ends there are cultural performances or official functions going on. Conveniently everything is close or at the Plaza de Armas: money changer, Peru rail office, tourist information desk, restaurants. It is a hustling , bustling place good for people watching. The problem is you get solicited, heckled a lot. You can't walk two steps without someone trying to sell you massages, painting, artisan stuff, a tour etc...
Great festive atmosphere. There is always an event happening at plaza de armas. I've been there on random days and I've seen parades, live dancing or music.

Place is alive day and night. A very lively and lovely "city center". You can walk everywhere to museums, shops, the cathedral and restaurants. When we went, there were parades frequently. Love the way that the old architecture from the Incan times were preserved.

Lots to see and do. Lots of restaurants, shops and activities surround the square. There is a beautiful cathedral and a smaller church. It's the tourist center of the city in that it's filled with activities and is a point for directions.

Pros worth the cons, but lodge in a quieter area. Beautiful old plaza surrounded by gorgeous churches built on and from Inca temples. Crazy, wild, touristy. But worth it. Evade the massage hawkers and don't get pulled into a restaurant unless you really are hungry. If you are lucky, there will be parades with exquisitely costumed groups of little and big people, dancing for their schools or communities with cheering throngs. Many ATMs and banks (many open on Sunday), beautiful Alpaca clothing and accessory shops, silver jewelry. Traditionally attired women and children with baby goats, lambs, alpacas and llamas - want a picture? Lovely to visit, wouldn't want to stay too close because the volume is loud and the festivities start early, even on Sunday. Discrete Starbucks, KFC, and McDonalds signs, but I recommend the Peruvian cuisine while you are in Peru. Short walk to San Blas (uphill - excellent miradors [viewing sites] of the whole city) and Qorikancha (lateral stroll).

Picturesque Square in the centre of Cusco. The Plaza de Armas is centrally located in Cusco and is a safe place to sit and watch the world go by - we came here a few times during our stay and it was always being used, by both tourists and local people too - there is inevitably every chance that you will be asked if you want to buy all manner of paintings, knitwear, scarves (this is Peru), just be firmly polite and say 'No'! Around the square are attractive two storey buildings with a veranda, which are either shops or restaurants (some money exchange too). The Cathedral also over looks the Square too which is well worth a visit, just for the architecture alone.Once it got dark, the wind did tend to make it breezy but as long as you were wrapped up, it was fine!

Plaza de Armas. Lovely plaza in Cusco. Amazing cathedral on one side and the other three sides are small stores - some high end and some more touristy. Also restaurants and bars and bakery/snack shops. Beautiful in the evening.
Always something going on. The buildings around are full of history, and the square itself is full of activity. There is always something going on, or a rehearsal for something.

Ok. Somewhat of a tourist trap but I thought it was worth seeing for Corpus Christi, which in when I went. Be prepared to be bombarded with people who want to sell you things - it gets to be annoying if you spend much time there. Cusco has a big problem with vehicle exhaust too - something I encouraged everyone local to talk to their government about.
Beautiful Plaza.. Lovely place just to sit during the day and gorgeous at night. The locals hang out here as do the tourists. Found myself here a lot just watching the people go by.
always great. this is a good place to sit and watch the people go by. this month there is a parade every day that honors the city

Great way to experience the culture. Great place to walk around or just sit around and people watch from painters to vendors... great little shops and has KFC and Macdonalds... if you really home sick...

lost in time _Cusco. One of the most beautiful colonial towns you will ever see. Everything about Cusco is amazing. People, Places and Food. 2 good days in the town are sufficient to explore this town.City Tour (Plaza de armas and other catherdrals) - a walking tour is good enough to cover this small town along with Saqsaywaman (take a taxi to go up and come down walking)closer to city you can explore the Maras, Salt village and rainbow mountain.Drink lot of Coca tea to deal with the altitude sickiness :)

Cusco popular and well used square. We were there on Flag Day with lots of military display and again several times.. It seemed that every important activity takes place in this square which also sports some very good restaurants around the perimeter. Enjoyed the students and smaller kids practicing for the Sun Festival.
Beautiful Plaza. We would visit the Plaza daily. Often dining in one of the local restaurants off the plaza. Many locals in the plaza. Often children doing dances in groups.

Go for lunch at a place on the second floor overlooking the plaza. The Plaza de Armas is a location where many Events take place. You will best enjoy it from a restaurant on the second floor that allows you to overlook the Plaza.
Come at sunset. It's a beautiful plaza and worth the visit. We had a laugh because I saw very few American fast food places in Peru but one of the most beautiful buildings on the plaza hosts a KFC!

Nice place, but needs more policing. There are many good things to see here. Sitting in the middle of the plaza was very cool. Visiting the churches and museums was very cool. People watching was very cool. I did not like the number of random people aggressively approaching to sell me stuff (tours, sunglasses, hats, photos with sheep, "massages", etc.). It takes away from the experience.
Safe and fun place . This is a great place to mingle with the locals and take in beautiful views of the city. We were lucky to be there during parades and parties in June.
Great place to people watch!. Tons of people here but great if you love to people watch! This area huge and have all sorts of shops and places to eat and tour agencies are everywhere!!!!
the heart Os Cusco. it's so good sit in the place and see the movement of the city. it's clean and theres a lot of bars and restaurants around.
Very Lovely. Really gorgeous plaza. Lots of touristy stuff because, well, it's Cusco, but still solid. Don't let people haggle with you.
Center of activity . A great place to hang out, buy local trinkets and just enjoy the culture. A central activity area with so much to see and do.

Cool city center. There is a lot going on here at almost any time of the day. There are people selling their wares and tons of dogs hanging around. In the evening when the lights come on is pretty cool, the concrete is so worn it reflects the light so much it is all bathed in a warm light.

Heart of Cusco - where things are referenced to. A pretty plaza, surrounded by the main Cathedral and a convent, and tourists shops located in "historic" looking buildings. At the center of the plaza is the fountain with Pachacutec statue with upraised arm. On days when the moon is out, apparently at about 5am in the morning, one could take a photo of the statue with the moon "sitting" in the palm of Pachacutec - or so I have been told - it was a new moon when I was there so did not manage to check that out. (someone confirm this later?)It is a nice place to sit in the sun to watch the world go by, idyllic if not for the crowds - sometimes there are performances in front of the cathedral, especially during festivities. Definitely, there are lots of street vendors touting "stuff" - just ignore them and they get the message.
City center, all starts here. Whatever you plan in Cusco, for individual tour starting here.City tours, excursions, shopping, restaurants, exchange offices..

The Heart Of Cuzco Faith. The main churches are around it. The atmosphere is of relaxation, and quietude interrupted by tourist restaurants on the periphery. The main cathedral and convent are prominent there.It is a good place to relax and soak in the atmosphere of Cuzco. It is lit up at night and has a special vibe then if you care to put on a good coat to keep warm.

Dreamy. So beautiful it seems surreal with layers of Incan and Spanish architecture and the Andes as a backdrop. Evenings are delightful. And on Sunday morning you may catch a religious parade if it's festival season (late May and June). We hung out here a lot and I'll give the same advise here that I did in reviewing the Historical Center: don't engage with anyone trying to sell you something. Just ignore.

Beautiful Sights and Special Events. Went here during a couple day stay in Cusco. On its own there are beautiful buildings and a nice view of the city, but it really comes alive with festivals and events! Worth a trip during the day especially if there are local events or parades.

Beautiful Plaza. Cusco was probably the place that we felt best shows off the magical side of Peru and Plaza de Armas is a big part of this. There always seems to be something going on and with many nice restaurants, not to mention the cathedral and churches there is plenty to see and experience
Super chill square . A nice location that's a de facto centre of Cusco. 2 cathedrals, nice open square and lots of shops and restaurants. Worth staying close by to enjoy more of cusco.

Always a Great Time. I think it would be hard to go to Cusco and miss the Plaza de Armas. It's smack in the middle of everything. There is always something going on, please performing, hanging out, etc. There was a graduation ceremony going on while we were there so we sat on the second floor of one of the restaurants and just watched the party that took place. You can't miss this!

Hub of the City. Plaza de Armas was filled with people celebrating the Corpus Cristo festival when I was in Cusco. Young men carried heavy statues of saints from across the province to the Basilica. The event was very interesting. Around the large plaza, where entertainment occurs almost everyday, there are fine shops, tourist traps, and many restaurants. Streets leading away from it have good shopping and restaurants as well.
Beautiful. Must visit while there! Lots of places to shop and eat. There are some places that offer free day tours as well, definitely take advantage!
lovely. it's a lovely plaza with several churches and food places to hang out. church entrance is free before 9am, small society church 10sol also worth a visit

Heart of Cusco. No trip to Cusco would be complete without sitting in this plaza enjoying the beautiful weather and people. Views of the church were great, restaurants, cafes, ATM/money changing services, and museums are all right there! We were there in early June and enjoyed a military parade and watching school children practice for an upcoming festival. Enjoy this plaza but don't rush it!!

Enjoy it.. Probably the best plaza de armas in Peru, it real shows the "two worlds" of cusco, with the incan emperor and the church in the background, this plaza de armas provides you with plenty of sitting room, a beautiful fountain, and statue, and some amazing views as the storms come in, and clouds form over the valley. I would say, make sure you spend some time here too, it's worth it. We spent close to an hour just enjoying the views.

Beautiful Plaza - check on our dog friend please. We enjoyed visiting the Plaza de Armas several times during our stay in Cusco. Missing our dogs back home we made friends with a local pup and gave him some food, if you happen to visit & see him (photos included) please give him some love for us. He is missing his right eye and partially blind in his left. There are SO many stray dogs in Peru & Bolivia it broke our hearts. We nicknamed him Quinoa. A little kindness goes a long way for these homeless pups.

Always Crowded and Fun on the Weekends. Plaza de Amas is the main square of Cusco. As a result, many local activities (such as dance, show, parade) happen here, especially over the weekend. It's a fun place to people watch or peak into the locals' lives. There are several churches to visit, and an even better place to take pictures (day and night). There are many shops and restaurants around the plaza, but the prices are usually higher than those in the less crowded areas nearby.

The heart of Cusco. We loved staying near the square. Like the locals, we spent most evenings after dinner, Walking around the area and watching the people. One Saturday afternoon we caught a dance performance celebrating a holiday. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants within a few blocks. It truly is the heart of the city

Heart of Cuzco!!. Many attractions around Plaza de Armas and surrounding streets, which is where you'll also find restaurants, hotels, and shopping (mcdonalds & starbucks). May Corpus Christie festivities.

Beautiful central square. Very clean, lots of shops, restaurants and businesses line the Plaza. The only drawback is the dozens of people handing out ads for massage or restaurants etc.. Special celebrations have many locals in full dress dancing in the streets.

A very nice town square. The plaza is usually a very nice relaxed place with locals and tourists going about their business. It's surrounded by churches, shops, tour agencies and restaurants in the streets leading from the plaza.The area around the plaza is the best area in town for restaurants.When a celebration is on the plaza can fill especially when there's a religious festival which can be quite a sight.Definitely head there when you get to Cusco.
A must-do. Although there isn't much to keep you busy, you have to visit the main square to see the cathedral and surrounding shops/restaurants
A nice square in the centre of town. A nice spot to just relax in the sun and do some people watching. There are restaurants around the square and most roads leading to it.

Fantastic Square. This is the centre of all tourist activity in Cuzco. It is clean, safe and very accessible by taxi or walking from all parts of the city. There are always National Police as well as Tourist Police on patrol to ensure there are no safety concerns for the locals and tourists.

We took the tour with Cusco-Peru.com, which included a walking guided tour of Cusco historical sites and among them the. We took the tour with Cusco-Peru.com, which included a walking guided tour of Cusco historical sites. We were able to visit all the important sites with the tour guide explaining the history of every place.

Beautiful . A wonderful place to visit, the center of the city full of locals and tourists alike. There are two churches to see and lots of restaurants. There are people who will hustle you to buy this or that or eat here but other than that it's nice to walk around

must visit at night. Absolutely wonderful plaza. The best plaza de armas in peru. Many local people and tourists hang out around the plaza. Very peaceful but yet sometimes very dynamic because of many activities.
great place. Lovely place to sit and soak up the atmosphere. Felt very safe even at night. Very clean . Loved it.
City Heart. NIght and day, always beautiful. Spend some time here, sit, watch people, visit the church, look for the best restaurant, wait for the spontaneous folklore shows in the evening.

Nice place to Chill n relax. One can sure enjoy mix of different cultures with lots of tourists from all over the world gathered in same place. Very nice place to hang out while relaxing in Cusco before our Saklantay Trek.

Corpus Christy festival is a stunner. A once in a lifetime experience for a tourist. The annual celebration included thousands of people watching their neighbors carry 13 huge statues. Each a representation of a saint or the Virgin Mary. One of the statues had been sent from Spain in 1652 as a gift for cusco but was supposedly lost at sea. It's wooden crate washed ashore months later and has been part of major religious holidays here for 350+ years. Each statute is carried by 40 men moving in unison to the beat of a band following them. Everyone is dressed in formal Costumes.

People Watching. Plaza de Armas is the central plaza of Cusco. The center of the plaza is a park with beautiful walkway, lawns, flowers, trees, fountains and benches for resting and people watching. Because it was right down the street from our hotel (Illa Hotel), it was essentially the starting point of our daily explorations. It is always busy with many Peruvian families and tourists enjoying the park, so it is a great "people watching" spot. There are several restaurants, many shops, currency exchanges, tour offices, and, of course, the Cusco Cathedral and other churches. If there is a local event or celebration happening in Cusco, it is more likely than not that it will be happening at this central plaza . It is also the starting (and booking) area for many of the city tours.

Great place.. It was great that the Plaza de Armas was still very colonial the architecture was super. During the day it was pedestrians only which makes it more comfortable to able to get away from the car fumes.

Central Plaza of Cusco. Plaza de Armas is the central plaza of Cusco. We walked by/through this plaza a couple times a day. It's nice during the day. But the lighting makes it really beautiful at night. The Cusco Cathedral and Templo de la Compañía de Jesús can both be found in the Plaza. You can also find some familiar places: Starbucks, McDonalds, KFC, Paddy's Irish Pub. The other restaurants around the square seem to be on the pricier side.

Thoroughly enjoyed the parade. What an amazing show of culture and tradition! We happened to vista Plaza de Armas during a very festive parade which was a highlight of our stay in Cusco. This market square is such a wonderful place in itself but the parade just made it even more enjoyable for us.

A great place to sit and relax or begin your day.. This square was VERY busy, as we were there during Corpus Christie holiday. There were literally thousands of people in the square and the roads were closed to traffic. No taxi service was available for blocks, so do not stay at a hostel or hotel on the Plaza if you need a driver to haul your bags. It is a good place to watch people, and to get acclimated to the higher altitude. Be prepared to say "No, gracias" a lot as the vendors can be very pushy. Many very good restaurants are located near or on the square and you can pretty much find ANY service here - from spa and massage to hiring tours. You can get a ticket that covers many tours from the visitor's office next to the smaller cathedral - this will save you lots of money!
Lots of Culture. Every time we walked through the Plaza there was some type of local activity. It was awesome to see the local culture. It was nice to sit and watch the people.
Locals and tourist. You can't miss and don't want to! Great place for people watching and for festival and parade events.
The center of activity. This is the center of activity in the tourist area of Cusco. Here you can eat, drink, shop, exchange currency, book tours, see llamas and visit historic buildings.
Very Pretty. This is a really nice park. Big area and stunning cathedral. Beautiful at night but seriously cold!!!

Charming Main Square. There's so much to do and see in Cuzco! We spent a full three days in the xity and didn't feel like it was enough. Some of my favorite parts of the city (other than the Inka trail) was spending time eating, shopping, vetting tour companies and seeing the cholitas with their animals (alpacas and lambs) in Plaza de Armas.
Center of all things Cusco. A must see... We did almost everything from here every day... Lots of good restaurants. Definitely do the daily free tour..

One of the great colonial squares in the Americas. I've seen a number of wonderful plazas around the world, and I love the Spanish colonial style. For example, Oaxaca is a classic.But Cusco was also the capital of the Incan Empire, which gives it a pre-Columbian context that is awesome. And Cusco is the jumping off point for Machupicchu and several other sites worthy of anyone's bucket list.If you are staying here, I'd suggest no directly on the Plaza itself, as street noise (such as the festival this weekend) may wake you up.

People watching at its best!. We were lucky enough to be in town for the beginning of the Corpus Christi celebration. The bands playing, people in costume and the general sense of celebration was wonderful. There are several good eateries on the Plaza and many more within walking distance. Fun to sit on the bench and watch all of the people!

Very colonial. It is a beautiful square with the cathedral and church. Lots of expensive alpaca shops, restaurants, cafes and ATMs. KFC, MacDonalds and Starbucks are lurking here under the colonnades.
Beautiful at Night. Lots of locals come out to enjoy each other and the sights and sounds surrounding the Plaza de Armas. At least, pass by to see it, even if you don't stop for a peaceful visit.
Lovely square. This is a wonderful place to just sit in and watch the community. There are vendors but not pushy and they will accept "no". There are many cafes and restaurants there to have a bite.
Plenty to see and do. Absolutely beautiful, plenty to see and do around the Plaza de Armas! Lot's of nice shopping to be done. Also many choices to eat.
Loved the centre of Cusco!. Fabulous place to chill for a couple of days and enjoy some ceviche and pisco sours!! We enjoyed just soaking up the atmosphere.
Beautiful Cusco's plaza. This plaza is the heart of Cusco. Around it there are great restaurants and shops. It is a place not to be missed.

Beautiful plaza!. We frequent the Plaza de Armas quite often. It's nice that they've closed the streets during the day so that you can walk freely w/o fear of getting hit! Well lit & beautiful at night; usually beautiful & sunny during the day with lots of benches so you can sit & relax. All around the plaza there are restaurants & coffee shops, plus souvenir places to explore & enjoy. There are typical restaurants as well as things like Starbucks, KFC & McDonalds. Lots of history in the cathedral and church that you could visit. Both are right on the plaza.

Loads to do here and very pretty! . This is a lovely square of restaurants shops and barsYou can get culture here, food, drinks, nightlife, relax in the square, architecture.It really is the centre of cusco for all areas.Worth a visit as an absolute must if in the area.There are some nice bars upstairs that look out over the square and lovely sun traps for afternoon drinks on the balconies.This is kept very traditional despite have a star bucks a McDonald's and a KFC in the realms.Truly beautiful and a joy to explore

Historic, significant. Another beautiful, historic plaza in central Cusco. Surrounded by retail and restaurants, one can easily spend a few hours people watching, shopping and enjoying a good meal. Visit the nearby basilica. Often the site of government ceremonies including parades.
Its worth it. Very nice area, good walking, restaurants, bars, coffee shops but avoid stores because they are very expensive, go to avenue del Sol instead.
Very pretty, great to walk around. Everything should walk around here. Only drawback is it is so crowded--too many tourists, too many touts.

A beautiful and very important historical point. Cusco's main square is a hotspot for almost evey important activity in the city. This plaza is surrounded by the two most important churches in the city, Inka palaces and colonial mansions. The square has been the place of executions during the colony and important activities during the history of Cusco. I recommend this place for every tourist that go to the city.

We visited this site multiple times. This is the center of Cusco. All good restaurants and shops are near this plaza. There are two cathedrals in the plaza. We visited one of them and it was very good. Today we shaw a colorful parade in the plaza.
Beautiful!. Such a historical place. Walking around the Plaza will cause you to stop and just think of who else has walked in this very place.

Plaza deal Armas. We were in Cusco for a weekend before our hike and one after the hike-a great way to get ready, and to finish off! The Plaza was beautiful and there were parades every day we were there. Very colorful, with lots of music and dancing!

Overrated place. Overrun with dogs and over eager sellers.. I was disappointed with most cities in Peru, primarily because being an animal lover, it is too painful to see the dogs trying to exist amidst the traffic congestion that prevailed in the cities. Many dogs are injured and spent their time trying to find food in trash. When you ask Peruvians about the dogs, they will tell you that the dogs have owners, that they are not strays. This problem is out of control!

Don't Miss This before Seeing Machu Picchu. Great atmosphere. While most people visiting Cusco will be there to see other sites, this is a lovely place to visit while preparing for the others.While initially planning to propose to my girlfriend in Machu Picchu, I decided to do so in front of the cathedral at Plaza de Armas (she said yes). While I wouldn't visit Peru to solely see Plaza de Armas, don't miss it if you're in Cusco!

Centrally located plaza. The Plaza de Armas in Cusco has it all. From people watching to cathedrals, to eating to shopping. The area is beautiful and worth a walk through. Beware of the constant soliciting.

Beautiful town square with amazing sites. This is the heart of Cusco city with lots of historic sites, cathedrals, museums, restaurants and bars. (you even have a Starbucks and KFC in the plaza).Can easily spend a few days just walking around and seeing the sites. This is also where a lot of parades and celebrations happen (Peru seems to love its parades - there were 2 in just the week I was there).

Large square surrounded by beautiful architecture and nice town views. This is a spacious square with well kept gardens and impressive colonial architecture, at the heart of the city of Cusco. Walking through the square or the beautiful corridors on all its sides is very pleasant. It is rather safe, but one night we observed some petty drug trade,
Big Plaza. Interesting sites... Is the center of Cusco. Trouble with over eager sellers all over wanting me to buy the same things.

Beautiful. Great location, surrounded by shops, markets, restaurants & bars. Locals are a bit overwhelming when you first arrive, trying to peddle their goods, just be friendly and politely decline and they'll leave you alone. Lots of tourist police if you do happen to run into any problems, but I walked around at night alone sometimes with no issues and felt perfectly safe.

Historic center Wow!. This is the heart of everything. The center of the culture, Empire, commerce, absolutely everything. 100% tourist driven and at times overwhelming with the amount of vendors, tour guide companies offering their tours BUT, it is a must see. 1500's architecture. Very safe. After 9 am no vehicle traffic allowed. Great place to sit, take in the history...views... and plan your day. Must see and unavoidable too.

Center for action in Cusco. We are not really city people but enjoyed how the Plaza de Armas changed every time we passed through - demonstrations, carnival games, speakers, processions, dancers, bands - something new every visit!

Beautifully mountain framed ancient meeting place. Everything seems to revolve around this square in Cusco, but just sit down on one of the many benches and absorb the atmosphere and the view of the amazing mountains - even get your running shoes rejuvenated for 10 soles by the numerous shoe shine experts! A fond memory of Cusco which is quite different from weekends to weeknights depending on the local public activities going on there.

A beautiful plaza, dominated by the cathedral. This is a great place to wander through and people watch, though there were far too many people, mostly women, trying to sell you a massage! The cathedral is definitely worth a visit, there are lots of restaurants, and you can shop, too.

Love it!. I loved just sitting in the plaza and people watching all while having everything right there. Just beautiful buildings, historical sites, shopping and food. Sit on a bench and soak it in then explore the rest of the city from there.

Great centralized place to start any day trip or just explore!. The Plaza de Armas is a very scenic area that serves as a great point of reference or jumping off point for anything you want to do in Cusco and the surrounding area. If you want to take a day trip somewhere, there are TONS of tour agencies near by. There are other plazas just minutes away by foot. Tons of places to eat and shop for anything you could want. Lots of churches and museums nearby. Anything you want is within walking distance here. It also served as an easy landmark when taking taxis.
Center of Cusco. A wonderful afternoon walk after lunch. Sat near the fountain for a while and then visited the Cathedral located on the Plaza. Good restaurants around the Plaza too.

The centre of Cusco tourism. If you are going to Cusco then you will be going here, try to get a hotel nearby and you will be close to everything you need. Lots of touts about offering travel packages and tours as well as lots of women offering massages. Restaurants and bars galore. Get a good look through the trip advisor ratings for good restaurants to eat in nearby.

Great place to people watch (and dog watch)!. This was a great central location and was comfortable and safe just hanging out there and people watching. The area is surrounded by great places to eat and shop but don't forget to just stop and enjoy your surroundings!

Wonderful Peruvian Plaza. We stayed in Cuzco for 5 days and frequented the plaza every day. It really is the place where everything happens. It is always alive with people and activities. It is very safe, with police everywhere monitoring things. Around the perimeter of the square are restaurants, shops, tourist info booth, Scotiabank and KFC chicken. Most of the bus tours begin and end here. It was festival weekend when we were here so there were school marching bands from every region of Peru. Very festive. At night it is well lit and offers a wonderful, peaceful backdrop for a stroll. It was definitely the nicest plaza we have seen in our three weeks here in Peru. Go see it and enjoy.

Beautiful!!. I loved walking down to the plaza and sitting around the fountain and people watch or enjoy an once cream. Every Sunday they have a 2 hour parade. So many shops and churches. So much to see and do!!

Plaza de Armas. Plaza de Armas has all you need.
Money exchange, Pharmacy, Artisan items, small shops and restaurants.
Plaza de Armas. The Plaza is a great place to navigate from to reach other parts of the city. It also has several churches and historical sites to visit.

A must see . The main place of Cusco. It's beautiful and impressive. Very well kept and also provides a nice view over the city and the mountains around. When the sun sets, the colors and the light are amazing. Very touristic, but definitely worth to see.

Beautiful . is impossible to go to Cusco and not spending time walking around Plaza De Armas, the park is so nice that you can just sit there for hours just watching the people, very nice restaurants around it and many places for shopping too

Nice place to sit and people watch. This plaza has plenty of restaurants and shopping. In old town with cobblestone streets and the cathedral to visit. Day time you will be harassed by trinket sellers to buy something.

Must visit if you're going to Cusco. The best thing about this point is that it's a great starting point. We always enjoyed the plaza and would start our adventures from here, walking to Sacsayhuamán, searching for the perfect restaurant, and looking for anything else you'll need in Cusco. The prices are most expensive the closest to the plaza. The farther you walk the cheaper they get. (Normally) Must see in Cusco!
Marvelous square. Centre of Cusco is really nice and marvelous, one of the most beutiful town we seen in Peru, definately worth to stay for 2 or 3 days before going to Machu Picchu or Ausungate.

Beautiful plaza...A must see!. This plaza is a must stop if you're in Cusco! There is a little bit of everything for everyone here. Restaurants, souvenir shops, money exchange stores, banks, travel agencies, markets, historical churches, festivals, pretty much anything you can think of, you can find here!

Beautiful historic square. Gorgeous square frequented by locals and tourists alike and with a lovely atmosphere day and night. Plenty of benches to relax on and the cathedral overlooking the square is beautiful. We spent several hours here with our cameras late at night and attracted the attention of the local kids who were intrigued and got an impromptu photography class. A very friendly, lovely place we'd like to have spent more time in.

Good at night and during the day. Night view is awesome!
Clean and safe. But lots of people selling goods, tours, food and massages.
Careful of the massages, they say 30 soles but when you go in, you are presented with a menu of different massage options ranging from 30-150 soles. Its safe though just dont get swindled.
Visit day and night!. Great place to take pictures, grab some local food, walk around and shop. At night it is lit up and there are lots of bars and restaurants to satisfy everyone.
Interesting square. While there, the striking non-union mine workers had taken over the square but that just made it all the more interesting.

Beautiful. . We walked to the Plaza from our hotel for Sunday Mass. We were extremely lucky as we arrived the Bishop was giving Mass. Afterwards there was a Parade. The views from the Plaza is amazing. Lots of restaurants and shops. Felt very safe to walk around town.

Beautiful Views and the Place to Be at Night but Very Touristy. The Plaza de Armas is a great place to walk around when you just arrived to Cusco or if you're looking to find a place for coffee or a drink. However, it is very touristy and if you look like a tourist, you will be approached continuously by people offering you everything from photos with baby llamas, to massages, to cigarettes, to drug-fuelled spiritual retreats in the Peruvian Amazon. Pro Tip: Grab a beer at Paddy's Irish Pub. If you manage to perch on the balcony you will get a great view of the Plaza de Armas.
Come during Inti Raymi!. The Plaza de Armas is the place to be during the ancient Incan reenactment of Inti Raymi. Make sure you get your seats on the terrace at least five hours in advance!
Beautiful Sky!. The first thing i noticed about Cusco was the amazing May sky, almost like it was alive. The pictures from Plaza de Armas are great, but seeing it with your own eyes is spectacular.

Lovely Plaza. This is a large plaza with plentiful seating to people watch! Lots of grass and flowers. Cathedrals, shops and restaurants surround the plaza. It would be more enjoyable though if locals trying to sell stuff weren't in your face all the time :(

lovely plaza in Cusco center. lined by all types of restaurants and gift shop and exchange offices. On a nice day its great for people watching and don't forget to check out the magnificent churches as well

Sit and Relax and Enjoy!!!. We stayed in Cusco for several days and enjoyed the Plaza de Armas. While there we were able to see several parades, and got to see beautiful costumes and traditions. We sat around the fountain taking it the busy streets people watching and enjoying the day and nightime activities. A must see!!

Trip of a Lifetime!. Wonderful place to have a stroll or sit in one of the cafes to watch the world go by. Almost every weekend something is going on in the plaza. Worth going to have a look. We spent a bit of time here.

Plaza de Armas. Beautiful square, surrounded by shops, money exchange, the Basilica (25 Soles to enter, with audio), and around the corner the Inka Museum (10 Soles, a very good history of Peru and its cultures). Park has lots of branches for people watching. Note: if you are going to take picture of the traditionally dressed people (sometimes with children and/or baby Llama's) they expected to be tipped!

Nice well maintained plaza. Nice well maintained garden plaza, worth doing a Free Walking Tour to get info and insight into the history. Very interesting history relating to the inca and rebellion against the Spanish. Lots of people selling things though.

Beautiful & Chocked Full. Serene, stunningly beautiful views of the mountains, sky, sunrise, and sunset. Plaza de Armas is Cuzco's answer to The Grand Place in Brussels or Plaza Major in Madrid - you get the picture. There are no cars allowed around the plaza so it's really a great place to just sit and people watch. There are tons of balconied restaurants just take your pick - in the four days we were here we tried several and I can honestly say didn't have a bad meal or experience. Nightlife abounds, just be careful with the alcohol consumption at this altitude. Just off the plaza there are a couple of huge artisan markets - if you're in the market for gifts to take home or all things Alpaca - at ridiculously low prices - well - you're all set. During our stay in Cuzco almost every trip out and about let through the plaza. Honestly, it's my favorite part of the city.
Must see. Must see also save in the evening. Local vendors all around. Make sure you have good bargening skills. Recommended MeuterMedia
Lovely, watch for scammers. This place was very nice and clean; however, locals advised me not to pick on tours promoted by single agents in this place since they usually add more to the price.
nice plaza. plaza de armas was a nice place to meet our friends in cusco many shops and restaurants in the around it .good for a relaxing coffee .had some problems with high altitute

The Heart of the City. Beautiful square - large and filled with shops and restaurants. Surprisingly, we encountered an Irish Pub next to the cathedral! We enjoyed walking the square window shopping and people watching. We were lucky enough to encounter a military demonstration that appears to be showing all forms of their military even local police and fire.

Beautiful Plaza!. This Plaza is just beautfiul. It has a mix of colonial and Inca's style. The cathedral is imponent and in the middle you would see the Inca. At day or at night it is just beautiful! Grab a sweater and take a walk to this Plaza!Tip: In one of the corners (next to the Irish pub or Papachos) there is a guy that sells tamales in the street. They are delicious. Really, try at least 2! Sweet or salty, they are outstanding and as of April 2016 they cost US$ 0.30 each (yes! one third of a US Dollar!)

May Day Parade. we arrived to a May Day Parade, all the troops, police, office workers, artists etc. a colorful parade of Inca dressed in traditional outfits. It was so beautiful, the music with drums and flutes, the dancing with beautiful hats, feathers and bells took our breath away. The city itself is beautiful, traditional buildings, shops, cafes and a festive atmosphere. Wefell in love with Cusco.

A Happening Place. Cusco is a wonderful city (except for the traffic) with joyful, optimistic people. The food is excellent, my favorite is the Lomo Saltado but, of course you must try the Alpaca and Cuy. There’s lot’s going on in and around the Plaza de Armas. The day we arrived we had a wonderful lunch on a restaurant balcony overlooking the plaza. It turned out there was a big fiesta going on celebrating a national hero. They were all dress in very colorful traditional native attire and danced energetically. There was wonderful music and a very festive atmosphere. The history museum in town is a great place to help understand the tragic and often violent melding of the Incan and Spanish cultures. There are wonderful ruins just a couple of miles from the center of town. You just need to get plenty of water, drink the cocoa tea and rest as needed to deal with the thin air.
The heart of Cusco. Lots going on in this plaza. Day or night. Churches, restaurants, museums and simply people watching.
Not charming . It seems pretty for 1 hour and that's it, you don't need to stay there longer. They have he same plaza in every colonial city in Latin America, may be less dangerous.

Very pretty squarw. Very pretty square in the central part of cusco. A fair amount of merchants selling souvenirs but if you are polite they leave you alone (and also actually have some quite nice souvenirs!). Nice-ish restaurants bordering the Plaza but the best ones we found were a couple of streets back to the north.
Favorite Plaza. By far my favorite plaza in Peru, I loved seeing it lit up at night. Also like that the buildings are kept traditional and even McDonald's can't put up their golden arches.

Spend an afternoon relaxing. Get a table on one of the restaurant balconies......there are many to choose from...or sit on a bench and get your shoes shined. A great place to people watch after all the ruins and shopping.

Nice and lively plaza . Fun plaza to walk around at all hours. There are many shops, restaurants, massage salons, bars, etc. around the plaza. This is where all the city activities take place. Be sure to go there on a weekend because there are shows, music, dancing. Great place to walk around, hang out, grab a coffee, or just sit and take a break.
Stunning. Gorgeous at both daytime and nighttime, and so different to most main plazas in South America. Only problem is the relentless hawkers offering massages and tours.

The main square in Cusco. Large uncrowded square with good views of the cathedral and up to the mountains. The hawkers are a bit of pain but leave you alone if you just say no thanks. Anywhere else there would be a lot of pavement cafes around the square but here if you want to sit outside you have to go up to the cafes which have balconies overlooking the square.

Lively Plaza. It literally isn't possible to miss this central square when visiting Cusco. It was lively every time we walked through and we were treated to festive dances and ceremonies on multiple days.

Hard to miss it. Yes another Palaza de Armas. Don't plan to go out of your way to visit this as you will not be able to avoid it.
You will see it, get the photos and move on.
One of the better plazas though.

Beautiful plaza but commercialized. Great to sit in the plaza and take in the views of the buildings, cobblestone roads, and sometimes even groups of singing musicians. Try to ignore the McDonalds hidden under an archway. Locals selling trinkets can get a bit aggressive, as well as those selling tours.
Visited January 2015

Beautiful Plaza!. While in Cusco, this was the central location to hang out. It is so gorgeous at night that we enjoyed just sitting on a bench and seeing all the tourists walk by in just about every language. In the plaza there is a cathedral which is beautiful to see. There are vendors asking for cheap massages (50 soles + tip) which are actually quite good, shops and restaurants galore. You won't go through Cusco without having been here, so no worries.
Quietly surprising.. Sat here for an hour in what I would have considered a peak time. It was gloriously peaceful around the churches and the central park..

Do'nt Miss It !. Ancient , quaint yet modern enough to provide all conveniences & fun. Eye - catching buildings , cobbled streets , market with long corridors , & beautiful arches. Its a delight . Many boutique restaurants & shops . The Plaza is awesome , indeed !
A nice central square. A nice place to sit and soak in the atmosphere of Cusco. Lots of places to eat, drink and shop all around the square.
Plaza de Armas. This is a good place to relax and you can visit the famous cathedral . If you're a dog lover, then you'll be happy to see lots of stray dogs in there.

very lively plaza in the center of town. we enjoyed finding a park bench here and just watching the comings and goings. The fountain, although not "allowed" and Lima wants to remove it, looks great while it lasts.

Full of life . This square is full of life. Every angel is equally ad beautiful as are the mountains behind it which just adds to the picture. You can clearly see the Spanish influence in the architecture and reminds you of cities like Toledo.

Where It Is Happening. Of course there is a certain touristy part of this plaza since it is the historical center of Cusco. Fortunately it is also a center point for the life of many Cuscoians since it also is surrounded by the pillars of everyday life like its church, its museums and its restaurants with its night life.

Gorgeous center area in the heart of everything. This is such a beautiful center square surrounded by stunning historic buildings and flooded streets of tourists and locals. Loved watching the sunset in the center near the fountain.
Cusco Visit. Beautiful Dpanish Colonial architecture with Inca elements.Amazing degree of Civilization at an Altitude of 11,000 feet.A must see Bucket List item.

Always Lots of People Strolling Around. This is an excellent spot to sit down and relax on one of the many benches and enjoy the sights and sounds of the city. Also a good spot to meet up with friends.
Nice area. Great area within Cusco. Nice views with many restaurants and shopping nearby. Old historical buildings located around the square.

Great People Watching in the Heart of the City. A lot goes on in this central plaza. Parades, people watching, vendors hustling for a sale, picture taking, etc. and plenty of bars and restaurants aound the perimeter. You cannot go to Cusco without spending some time here.
People Watching. The best city square for sitting and relaxing and watching people go by. An oasis in a busy but historical city.

Plaza de Armas. Plaza de Armas in the centre of Cuzco is a very nice place in a very nice town. It offers a Great atmosphere, lots of local shops, bars and restaurants in a city with beatifull old buildings and churches. It is nice to walk around and explore tye city by foot and taste the atmosphere and just look at the local people and the life passing by. Also it is avery touristic cuty but but this was creating also a more cosmopolitan atmosphere. Great place to visit when you are in Peru.
Plenty good restaurants and shops. We experienced a civic parade with a band and police marching. Very impressive. The balconies, many being restaurants were very ornate.

Nice plaza. Nice plaza to mingle but too many people asking if thou want a massage or tour! It gets really annoying! Have a look at night as it has a different atmosphere , take the walk up next to the cathedral and kfc as it is a lovely walk.The cathedral was expensive and was done very quickly.

Beautiful . A square that's very clean & bustling with people all day every day. Exquisite churches & views surround the plaza & it has a beautiful fountain in the centre of the square. Dotted all round the square is a variety of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants with little streets going out in all directions with more cafes, restaurants, shops etc.Your bound to find somewhere to eat & a trinket or two to take home with you....A lovely place to just sit and take in your surroundings, people watch & watch the world go by.At times it can be like running a gauntlet with people trying to solicit you to come and try their restaurant or have a massage! - after 4 days I was getting fed up with it! A lovely place to see.

Nice central Square. The main square in Cusco is very picturesque. There is a cathedral and a jesuit church on the square as well as a number of restaurants. Lots of benches for relaxing and people watching

Good for 15 minutes. We visited the Plaza de Armas, expecting to see lots of interesting, historic buildings. While there are some, most of the plaza is a tourist mecca with restaurants of all kinds (though none seem to be high quality - go just off the plaza for those). In the end, worth seeing, but not a major attraction for us.

Amazing plaza. It's an amazing plaza with 2 cathedrals, a statue as a fountain, lots of restaurants and small shops witth local products. The Peruvians use the Plaza for their parades and celebrations. There are a lot of them. Very colorfull, active and entertaining.

Lively at night and just as lively in the morning!. This is a wonderful place to visit. Here you can find Starbucks, KFC and other good neighboring restaurants and stores. I spent my time with part of my group buying many souvenirs in the little surrounding shops, taking pictures and then ate at a really well put-together restaurant. During the day, culture was present. The people were up and about. Everyone was nice (as usual). For the young and curious, the nightlife was just as inviting. Bars within the city, not far from this Plaza, were open and welcoming! It was here at night you could see the lively youth of Peru and get a taste of what their idea of fun looked like.
Awesome fountain!. The opportunity for great pics and sounds of the city can be found here. Shopping is great, with many options. People watching at its best.
wonderful. Plaza de Armas is beautiful and especially at night is a night city like many other safe and well do not forget to take pictures at night

Lively . It is beautiful and the center for activity in Cusco City! I enjoyed just sitting and people watching! There was a parade the day I was here . These kinds of festivities happen often in this city

Beautiful square! The churches are exquisite!. The plaza is beautiful! It has a subtle European feel with amazing energy. I definitely recommend spending time there. Visit the cathedrals - they are beautiful! If you can take a stroll in the evening also. The atmosphere is magical - the evening lights make for a romantic ambiance.Many of the restaurants on the square are tourist traps. So you might be better off wandering on to a side street to find lunch or dinner. However I did hear from a local that Limo or Limon (?) - the one next to the KFC-was good, though pricey. Depending on how into history you are - I don't think you need to pay for a tour. Just entrance into the churches.

Center of the Action. This is the main plaza in Cusco and is home to the City Cathedral and La Compania de Jesus. Plus oodles of shops and restaurants. It is the perfect place to go people watch or to find the perfect gift for your family and friends. Beware the folks trying to lure you in to their restaurant as most are mediocre at the best. The gems don't need to draw anyone through their doors.
Nice place . You can find everything there, from restaurants (some have shows), to shopping and tours. So if you don't know what to do you can just talk to some agency and they can help you out.
Really Cool. Great plaza with lots of restaurants and shopping. two large churches. We felt very safe.There were also lots of small streets coming off the plaze with more restaurants and shopping.

Lovely place. The place is really nice, with many restaurants, shops, churches and hotels around it.
The fountain in the middle is probably a favorite picture for tourists.
There are many places to sit and to enjoy this wonderful place. I would recommend to see it.
Bustling with activity. A beautiful European style square surrounded by a cathedral, shops and restaurants. I love hanging out and people watching.

Beautiful place with a lot of life.. Around the plaza are many restaurants at upper floor with a view to the cathedral. We could see many boys and girls leaving school, and the girls and women with the baby lamas - very colourful!

The place to start your trip to Cusco. Great restaurants, don't miss the cathedral. This is the "center" of the town and a nice, safe pedestrian zone. The restaurants are good and cathedral should not be missed.
Must See. This area of Cusco is very safe for travellers. Many shops and eateries around the area. The cobble stone streets add to the beauty.

Nice day trip. The cathedral is nearby and there is just about any store you may want/need. Love seeing the shop owner's dogs "play" on the streets in their rompers/bows, adorable. The sight of the mountains all around makes for some good pictures.

Nice little place, lots going on. Like any plaza, there's always a lot going on here, so it's nice to just sit and people watch. Sometimes there are groups of people dancing, random shows going on, and lots of cool restaurants and souvenir shops around to. Nice feel to the place, makes for a nice wander
Fun at night!. Lots of shops (but hold on to your soles!), including a good variety of restaurants and coffee shops. We enjoyed a Starbucks while cruising the square.

Beautiful, but filled with touts. Plaza de Armas has gorgeous architecture, and history, and if you need anything in Cusco from hiking poles to food, this is a good place to start. You will however be bombarded by touts trying to get you into their restaurants or sell you massages, so beware.
Plaza. A nice place to walk around, eat and shop. There are many museums, cathedrals, etc., in the perimeter

center of cuzco. there are lots of great restaurants and museums near this square, and it's also where you'll find traditional dancing and sometimes demonstrations and election rallies, but it's beautiful at night and during the day, an unforgettable part of any visit

The heart of Cusco. Lovely place to stroll through. Tons of shops and restaurants around. Also the main cathedral. The San Pedro market is also nearby. Lots of places to sit and watch the world go by.

Beautiful Plaza. I enjoyed walking through this Plaza during my time in Cusco, it was neatly kept and it is a great meeting place because all around the Plaza are eateries, tour companies, churches, the wonderful fountain. Each day while in Cusco, I came to the Plaza and would sit on a bench and people watch (Great PlaceTo Do This). Police presence was very visible because this is a high tourist area. It is still best to watch your belongings because there are many locals who will be approaching you to get massages, tours or trying to sell you different tourist souvenirs.
Plaza de Armas. My wife and I will never forget our time in Cusco. And the Plaza de Armas (Main Square) is proof of that so if you are planning a Cusco trip you should go right now!

See the Heart of Cusco. Plaza de Armas is the Center of Historic district in Cusco. From there you are in front of two of the most outstanding colonial churches of the city. If you can, sip a tea on a second level café watching the sunset. I'm sure you will enjoy it!

Sit and relax... . Whenever you have to make some time or just want to relax, this place is a good choice to go and chill. You can be on the main plaza dribking an "inka cola" soda and watch all the tourists walking around. There's a fountain in the center, the main church and is surrounded bu restaurants that have nice balconies.Conts - there's a lot of "tour guides" that constantly approach to the tourists. - there's a lot of street dogs playing around.
Plaza de Armas. Plaza de Armas is beautiful during the day but spectacular at night! A great place for pictures. The walk up the hill to see it isn't too bad, and it's worth the time and effort.
Dinner in the Plaza. Had dinner at Limos and had a wonderful experience with delicious food! Ate lunch on the balcony of Papachos the following day and was more casual but equally as delicious!
Beautiful architecture . Not sure what all the hype is about. Nice plaza with lots of shopping and eating options. You need to dodge all the vendors trying to sell you stuff.

Right in the centre of Cusco. Located in the centre of Cusco, it is surrounded by lots of shops and restaurants. Great place to people watch, stare at the architecture and learn more about Cusco. Really enjoyed relaxing in this plaza.

Active central plaza. The Plaza de Armas was just around the corner from our hotel at the Casa Andina. The square was constantly active until often late into the night. There are lots of vendors hawking their wares in the square, but a polite, but firm no usually discourages them sufficiently. The statue of Pacha Cuta (spelling) is very nice.
A beautiful community spot. Simply stunning views and pleasant community area surrounded by shops and restaurants. Very nice place to sit any time of the day or evening to people and dog watch.

Great sightseeing. The plaza is a very busy area with many shops and restaurants. There are a lot of attractions nearby and many things to see and do. We had lunch at Paddys restaurant and the beer and food was good.
Plaza de Armas. Stunning architecture, weird tourists, smell of food, lots of daily life happening right before your eyes
plaza Cusco. lovely city Cusco, the people, the amazing natural places as their food delicious, the typical market as san pedro

Great location!. Plaza de Armas was maybe my favorite place at Cusco. The pictures I saw in the internet are not compared to the reality. The place is beautiful, specially at night. Worth to spend a good time there just walking around and enjoying the view. Recommended!

Amazing. Plenty of locals during the evening, is a nice place to stay. Surrounded by touristic restaurants, but amazing views in those with balcony to the square. Is plenty of sellers... rings, buses, disco bars, food, but still remains a calm place from the sunset.
Beautiful Square. Plaza de Armas is a great spot to stop in Cusco. It is the center of activity for the city: parades, speeches, and great food!
Beautiful Place. Really neat in the evenings and alive with locals filling every bench. Although the shops are touristy it still has a very original feeling.

An amazing square with many bars and shops. This is one of the most famous squares in the city. One can plan their trip to Machhu Picchu and Sacred valley here. The best option is to ask around for possible options after arriving in the city and then going on the trip. There are good options to shop around and also a nice place to visit some bars in the city.

A beautiful place to enjoy the sunshine.. This ancient square is broad, bright, and surrounded by an intriguing mixture of Inca and Spanish colonial architecture. The Cathedral stands on the North side, a second large colonial church domination the East side. The West and South sides are lined by beautiful colonnades - supporting terraced cafes, tea-rooms, and restaurants; many embellished with intricate wooden carving on balconies and window frames.The Centre of the square is situated around a large fountain, topped with a brilliant sculpture of an Inca Inca (King), and some grassy areas for sitting and relaxing.

Plaza de Armas. Forever etched in my mind, one of the best experiences in Cusco was to stroll sit look and enjoy the feeling of being in such a beautiful historical place, every day a pleasure to absorb the scenery and the every day life in this amazing city. So much to experience churches, restaurants, shops and the fountain not forgetting the people of Peru.

Nice place to chill. It is a nice green place to relax, there is always a lot of people there so if you wanna meet people or just look at the life in cusco, it is a good place to start. We hang out there lots of evening. Reading, talking before coming to diner. A lot of tourist info around the place but i highly suggest going further from the place to have food, you can find cheap but amazing food 3min away from the place.!

Wonderful place to people watch and get to know the city.. This plaza is one of the nicest places to sit and watch the world go by. There are churches and shops and restaurants surrounding it. The locals and tourists alike gather here to meet and chat. The fountain at the center is beautiful, and it is a good to stop by here at different times of the day to see the lighting change.
Clean and safe. Even walking around here at night we felt no fear - as lots of people both locals and tourists out and about having late dinners and just having a look around

Worth checking day and night. Epicenter of touristic Cuzco!Great view towards all the mountains surrounding Cuzco.Take a breath and enjoy the surroundings before heading to San Pedro's market or bohemian San Blas!

Centre of town. Plaza de armas is a great central location. The cathedral is beautiful and there are parades around the square for special events. We were there on Easter Sunday and there was a huge parade at lunch time and then in the evening there was another one. The square is surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars. Even Starbucks, McDonald's and KFC are on the square. It is good though that they are all in old style buildings and don't ruin the look of the square. The walking tours start from here and you can find local people selling everything from alpaca jumpers to sunglasses. There are even people walking around with llamas for photos.
Worth visiing the night. Very pittoresque square, the main one of Cusco.You should absolutely visit it in the night because the lights make it look more brilliant.

Beautiful square and epicenter of historic Cusco. Very clean and well kept area. Very well restored churches and buildings... And a large number of good ( yet a bit pricey) restaurants and stores. Several ATMs as well

Lovely main square with some great restaurants. The square itself is lovely. You can sit on the cathedral steps or on the benches but not on the grass. There are some great restaurants - Limo, Papachos and Paddy's Irish Bar around the square which are well worth a visit.
Downtown cusco. Lovely Main Street area of history, churches, shops, restaurants. Some street vendors. Relaxing place to walk and sight see

Beautiful Square. My wife and I had a drink over looking Plaza de Armas, then ate our sandwiches in the park. Beautiful, old architecture, great people watching. Our time was limited, but there is an abundance to do if you have the time.
Beautiful Historical sites . Visited the place twice, one in day and another In evening to enjoy the view. Lots of local hanging out in the area. There's load of restaurant nearby the square

Multiple visits, nice to sit and relax! . I came here multiple times, every time was awesome, it's nice if you want to get photos with Peruvian women with their animals(they will ask for money, I give 2 soles) ask if 2 soles is okay before going ahead with the photo, if not they ask for more. Other than the consistent sales people following you, the policia should tell them to keep moving if you say no, if they are around. This place is a have to see spot.

Beautiful main square. Vibrant square at center of Charming Cusco. Plenty of security for those worried about traveling internationally now. Very impressive square with a gorgeous fountain. Many restaurants and shops for travelers to peruse. Bargaining recommended!

Cusco Magic. I was there in March with my friends. I really enjoy it this place. Main square has amazing architecture for all borders. I visit this Square in many times, but when we stay there with our Tour Guide of Inka Altitude Travel Company we know many things about this Square. On inka's time were very important and sacred. I love Cusco. We really recommend
To watch the live goes by.... Plaza de Armas of Arequipa was nice but Cusco's is niciest. It is a good place to relax and watch the people going by.
Tourist tour. A must see for visitors giving you a real feel for the area and the people who live there Spanish would be helpful

Main Square of Cusco. This is your starting point for Cusco. This big square which is surrounded by a cathedral, a church, and a nice park with a fountain. Lots of ladies dressed traditionally with llamas asking to take photos, most just want $1 Sol.
Nice place to rest and take it all in.. Shops and restaurants all around. Police patrolling so nobody trying to sell you something. You can just take a break here and enjoy the area.
Very quaint!. Excellent place for a stroll. The architecture around is magnificent, and the cathedral and the gardens are a sight to see.
Main square of Cusco. If you get lost with you friends meet here, as everyone knows this square and helps you even if you do not speak Spanish)))
lots of great food and bars..lovely square to rest. go and sit in square bench and soak in all the beauty of the people and the place. The square is quaint and interesting churches and history

Safe and beautiful. All building exteriors are protected and can not be altered, but the interiors can be. It is lovely to see a 500 year old building still being used. Everything can be found in the Plaza from gift shops, travel supplies, restaurants, money exchangers as well as tour services. For those who need that touch of the US there's KFC, McDonald's and Starbucks, but i would highly recommending trying the many local restaurants that offer 5 Star meal for $20 US.

Nice Place to Walk and Relax in the City. Plaza de Aarmaz is located in the heart of Cusco city. It is organized clean and well maintained. It was so nice walking around and sitting on the garden while enjoying clean air.

The Hub of the Tourist Area. When it comes to visiting Cusco, this is where you'll end up. Outside the plaza area is the city which is not pretty but the plaza is nice and you're at walking distance from the historical buildings and museums. You will be approached by people selling their goods but they're not too aggressive.
Must visit. Very Spanish looking, picturesque. Many boutique shops, restaurants. Beautiful park to sit and enjoy the view.

Big Plaza full of restaurants and shops. It is a huge plaza to hang around, grab a bite (lots of restaurants around), take pics with llamas (lots of girls and ladies with llamas around who will let you take a pic with them for a tip), shop (lots of shops around) or walk around.

A great place to watch the world go by. Despite a slight mist which cleared quickly you can certainly see the whole populations of the world go by. In a wonderful setting with the cathedral as a backdrop, a gentle spray from the fountain and gardens all around you would not know you were in the heart of a peruvian city. Once my head had cleared and i was feeling less dizzy with the altitude it was amazing to see people from all over the world using Cusco as a base for onward journey's to Machu Picchu. I had read reviews were people moaned about the characters trying to sell you hats, and trinkets and sunglasses etc but this all added to the atmosphere. It was a beautiful place to just chill out and sit in the sunshine for a few hours.

Walking Cuzco. My partner and I have just arrived to Cuzco yesterday. And we have been walking as much as our breath let us do. Is really hard to skip a corner, a window or beautiful colorful local women and do not take a picture. Everywhere and everything is really beautiful. A bit of dirty waste left over on some streets, or the amount of people offering us all type of art-crafts would be the only uncomfortable thing around
Venders are relentless. We couldn't look around for all the venders hounding us and just try to take a picture of the women dressed in the local dress without paying.
Busy Center of Town. This area was so vibrant! There were a lot of people walking around, talking, hanging out, etc. We enjoyed people watching, shopping, and eating around the Plaza.

Front and Center. The beating heart of Cusco. It's always full of activities day and night. You could even have a night tour! The culture is so alive at every corner and every local, I guess this is why Cusco is so apart from any other cities. Its colonial churches are still so pristine and you need to see each one as you walk by to appreciate them even more. When inside of these premises, however, cameras are not usually allowed to help the preservation of these historic architectures. Please be mindful to follow their rules. Common courtesy never hurts. Restaurants & coffee shops are abundant, serving local and international cuisine. The plaza caters for all citizens of the world. You won't feel at a loss, trust me. As in any place you visit, always extend respect to everyone you meet. Cusco is truly remarkable and the experience will stay with you.
It's the heart of the city. Around this square are many shops including a Starbucks and a McDonald's and KFC Pick any of the side streets to explore other areas
Plaza de Armas. Again so much history, plenty of churches and historical building to see. A nice place to sit and take in the surroundings, the people, bounded by mountains and interesting buildings.

Central Square of Cusco. A great place to hang out. Enjoy a coffee. Find a restaurant. There are churches and museums to explore. And it always seems to be bustling with locals. Careful crossing the streets to get there…traffic rarely slows down / almost never stops.

Nice place to go and have a coffee. There are a lot of coffee shops and restaurants around the Plaza de Armas, many with balconies. Its a nice place to sit and have a coffee. The view from the balconies of the restaurants around is nice and the place is usually calm and quiet. Perfect place to take a break.

Great city center. Lots going on constantly. Visited Peru with family back in June 2015. cusco was incredible and the Plaza De Armas has a lot to offer during this time. June is a busy month due to the festivals and beautiful weather,
Visit to Plaza de Armas. Very nice square with the cathedral and a nice statue in thr middle. Clean and safe. Many retaurants at the square. Close too other attractions.

Beautiful place to stroll and sightsee. Beautiful place to stroll and sightsee. People watching was great everything from tourists locals street vendors and we saw a religious parade with many local flavors. Busy area of shops and architecture all around. Can find most of what you might need in area and just sit and talk in the view statues churches and people.

Incredible & Lively. Super fun times! We were so lucky to be in the Plaza de Armas during one of their many festivals! Sunshine, stunning architecture, colorful traditional dress, great restaurants, friendly people-- whats not to love?!

Beautiful city. The plaza and center of cusco is really the prettiest in all Peru. The Cathedral is
Magnificent with its two side altars. We enjoyed the evenings in the square with many restaurants and bars for All Taste buds. Shopping is good here however go
Off the side street for
More reasonable priced items.
Great!. Amazing plaza! Everything on and around it contributes to its beauty. The mountains give a magnificent background. Enjoy it!

Plaza surrounded with culture, history and architectural style. After visiting the church and having marveled the architecture and history you are able to walk in the square and do the tourist stuff or walk a couple blocks more and immerse yourself amongst the locals and experience the taste and sounds of what day to day living is like.

Charming. Visited Cusco with my BF last spring. Cusco was charming! Plaza de Armas is the central location of the city and where you can find anything you need - pharmacy, tour operators, food etc. There are really cute restaurants with balconies in the square. I enjoyed just relaxing on a bench and people watching.

Historically significant. Beautiful plaza in the middle of Cusco. Lovely architecture surrounds it.
It's a bit depressing and exhausting though, because every three steps, you get accosted by someone trying to sell you something.
This is where the Spanish killed Tupac Amaru.

Nice but.... Plaza de armas is the center of Cusco and sure has beautiful monuments around it. The architecture is great, it is a clean and well preserved park and you can have a nice look of cristo blanco on top of the hill, but it is also very touristy, many people harrassing you to buy souvenirs, get a massage or eat at their restaurant.
Picturesque . Beautiful square in the heart of Cusco. Lots of nice restaurants and cafes around the square, a good place for people watching!

Lively place to hangout and catch the culture.. Nice weekend food fair. Visit the Starbucks for a treat away from the 'madding crowd' overlooking the square. A nice authentic experience. Take a taxi it is cheap!
Nice to visit. Take time to visit all the différent things around the square. Also visit the public market a few blocks away for souvenirs.

Beautiful Architecutre. **March 2013** No trip to Cusco is without a visit to the beautifully historic Plaza de Armas. Take some time to take in the surroundings and visit the shops and cafes the look onto the plaza.

Great Plaza. Touristy spot, but a great place to gather, sit, eat and people watch. Also interesting that there seem to be almost daily parades!
The Basilica is not to be missed.

Nice central plaza. I loved the atmosphere and the view of cusco from the central plaza! There are a lot of things to do near the plaza de armas, nice restaurants and cafes.The cathedral is beautiful and the Iglesia de la Compañía de Jesús is also worth a visit!
