Vibrant day and night. W visited the Plaza de Armas during the day and also in the evening. Quite a different experience but both are extremely worthwhile. The Plaza is clearly the nerve center of the city and has a sense of vibrancy and life at all times. The streets leading to and from the Plaza are also worth exploring. We wish we had had more time to spent in the Plaza. In fact, we wish we had taken an extra day in Cusco to explore the city in more detail as it looks a really interesting place.
The main Plaza in Cusco. Plaza des Armas is main and most interesting place in Cusco. It is a must for the visitors to watch the local people in Inca dresses all day long

Don't take the GOAT!!. I loved the old Mayan women who would walk up and hand you a baby goat (adorable), then take your picture and tell you that you had to pay them for using the goat! I'd seen this done in the middle east with camels, it was hilarious.

Main historic square with sites and restaurants. The main square in Cusco has two churches to visit along with great shopping and restaurants. The seating area around the fountain is beautiful as well.

VERY CROWDED AND ALWAYS INTERESTING. There was a dance festivakl on when we were the at the evening, and this was amazing. All the different dance styles and traditional dress was well worth staying for, although did lose a touch of tradition by most of the dancers wearing jeans!The atmosphere was fantastic, and we actually stayed for over 2 hours, just enjoying the locals and the difference from the day time. Is well worth going for an evening walk, as you never know what will occur.
Beautiful. Beautiful square, kind people. The churches nearby were stunning to look at. The backdrop of the mountains was beautiful!

Soulful and empty in the rain. The first day we came upon the square and it was pouring rain, filled with shadows and only school children and stray dogs...vs. the next day when it was sunny and FILLED (like Disneyland filled) with tourists. The architecture is fantastic. It's got soul. More so in the rain.

History that is as alive today as it was a hundred plus years ago.. Our Guide, Edger, was such an amazing storyteller that his knowledge was astounding. I didn't do a lot of reading and research about the locations before my visit, but now I just want to know EVERYTHING!

Top place not be missed in Cusco. Main Cusco downtown (Plaza de Aramas) where there is tourists all the time, Many attraction with walkable distant. Nice restaurants around the place. Close to the Cathedral and many Museums....Nice picturesque place for your memories of the Cusco. Just be aware of all the people trying to sell your tours, we had our tours booked already so never tried anyone. International ATMs around even if you need some US dollars or Euro.

Lovely plaza. I travelled with my girlfriend and we loved the Cusco city! There are a lot to see around this plaza, including the fantastic cathedral! Go to South America! Go to Peru! Go to Cusco! You'll never regret.
Great People Watching. Wonderful environment; easy to dodge in and out of stores on a rainy day! Would highly recommend sitting in one of the balcony restaurants and enjoying the views

Very busy main square. Lots of shops and street vendors plus there were gardens to relax in. The Cathedral was right there as were several other churches. The only bad thing was that the altitude was getting to me.

Great experience of Peru culture. Stayed only for one night as it was a rushed tour but loved ever minute of it. Its well worth the visit to soak up the atmosphere on route to machu picchu or after your visit

Excellent for people-watching, although the sellers will test your patience. This is a great place to marvel at the architecture, enjoy the weather and watch the locals relax and have fun. One thing we really took notice of while in Peru is that the people genuinely seem to love being outside and being social. Just observing this in the Plaza was rewarding. There are plenty of police in the area should you feel unsafe. Don't get too anchored to the Plaza though as there are wonderful buildings and old streets to wander through right in the area. One caveat though is to be ready to fend off the constant barrage of street sellers.

Tourist Galore. ...and not in a good way. The restaurants are overpriced (for Peru) and not of particularly good quality. Not bad, though. The stores primarily sell low quality tourist items. Although you can find a Kuna (among the highest quality Alpaca quality items in the country).
this is the heart of cusco. when you are herte youre gonna feel that special feeling of being at a so significant place where it started and finished the great empire in south america.
Beautiful Plaza. Even though this is a touristy plaza we loved it. There is lots of food, churches and shopping. It's fun to be surrounded by so much beauty in the heart of cusco
Beautiful place to people watch. All roads lead to the Plaza...or at least it seems that way. This is a great place to people watch and stroll through on your way to your next adventure.

Main Place to visit. The great square. The architecture all around is worth watching. Do not miss nearby lanes, just adjacent to the cathedral where you will see great stone walls of multi joints stones

Stunning at night.. What a plaza! This plaza is a great mix of old, historical sights coupled with some newer restaurants, shops, and attractions. Make sure you stop by the cathedral and make a reservation at one of the restaurants that overlooks the plaza. Venture down any of the side streets to find shops that are perfect for souvenirs.

Loved every minute in Cusco. This is a mix of new and old. Historic center is beautiful. Visit the cathedral, sit in the plaza, visit the fab restaurants and bars. Can recommend Hotel Rumi Punku not far from the plaza. Great place to stay

Great Public Attraction in Cusco!. The Plaza de Armas is a beautiful impressive attraction in Cusco. There is nothing in the world like central/south american public spaces and plazas, and this one is no different. Surrounded on two sides by large impressive churches, with fountains in between the Plaza de Armas is a photographers dream! Beautiful mountains in the background help to backdrop an impressive sight.
Main square of the city.. Main square, with loads of little shops and restaurants surrounding it. You just never know when a parade may erupt!

Very imposing.. This is another beautiful plaza we saw as apart of a tour group in Cusco.Cusco is a plaza that has plazas and streets that tell much about the architecture of the time.Just walk and look Cusco is. Wry nice with its plazas and inca streets.
Center of the City. A visit here is like going back 200 years. Several historic churches along with great views of the mountains. Wonderful site.

Central hub of Cusco city. Definitely one of the first places you should go when visiting Cusco. The square itself is beautiful, its bordered by the amazing Cusco cathedral, and the stores and restaurants around are all great. The street vendors are great if you want cheap "alpaca" products, but if you want some real quality stuff I recommend checking stores. You don't have to spend too much time in the square, but its a great place to start or sit and relax after a long day.
Don't miss this charming square at night.. Musicians played instruments, local students danced, and we sat on the steps of cathedral and watched all the activity!

Nice visit . Beautiful at dusk!
Great little hub of the city, we found most of our favourite spots within one or two blocks of this square
Amazing. I think it is the only square in the Americas with two beautiful, large churches. The square is also very picturesque. A must in any of your travels.

Heart of it all. Locals and tourists mix at the heart of Cuzco. What's most fascinating is the mix of Spanish and indigenous influences in the buildings / cathedrals and open spaces deep in the Andes.

Fun! . Went to the plaza for the carnival. So fun!!! And so crazy! Everyone had to fend for themselves with foam sprays and water balloons! It was nuts! We joined the fun after a bit of hesitation. The plaza itself it beautiful and full of great restaurants and shops. Have fun!

Here is all the action. This is the center of town amt there are so many very interesting sites around. It is interesting just to walk the square or sit and watch the local community do their thing. We where very lucky to have arrived on the day of the carnival it was so colorful but the kids with the spray cans I bit of a problem for cameras. Loved every minute.

Heart of Cusco. Its the heart of the place and full of history/culture. The square is basically surrounded by historical sites and most major events happen here. I was lucky enough to witness a parade here last June as part of their month long celebration for saints. The area is kept relatively clean considering how busy it was and as expected, lots of restaurants and shops targeting tourists.Good spot to take people/culture related photos as many locals hang around here as well. U'll also find the twice daily free walking tours of Cusco here. 10am and 2pm if memory serves me correctly and is worth the time. at night u'll find most bars/clubs at or near the plaza and night life is pretty good in cusco. Local traffic is abit chaotic though but thats to be expected

Spot to Sit. This was a nice plaza to sit and relax for a few minutes. There are two beautiful cathedrals, as well as some stores on another side of the plaza. If you sit for too long be warned ladies will try to sell you their wares. If you don't mind that, you will enjoy a beautiful sight abd great people watching. If you don't have a ton of time in Cusco, I suggest skip this.
Wonderfull. One of the nicest plaza I have visited.Was sitting there for hours. watching the nice area around. So coulerfull especially when it is sunny
Nice sport to relax and people watch. Very nice place to spend some time in but can be quite pricey for general stuff but there are some great value places to eat.

Magical in the evening. Great atmosphere lots of lovely places to eat...
Don't forget to try Al paca and the guinea pig whilst here.
It's great seeing the old Incan stones around the area

Beautiful, historical square. My advice - just sit in a cafe or on a bench. Yes, you will be continuously approached by women and children selling their wares, but hey, what's a few dollars for the opportunity to engage with the locals. Loved it.
Attractive square. Nice place to sit and admire the heart of Cusco. Many benches and the lawns are very manicured. Hassel factor is medium-high.
nice place to procastinate. even though i met my partner days apart we united at our hotel and my partner bought different tours than me, but no problem...next tour we will make some tours together.
Nice to see if you have the time. Nice Square to see at night, lots of locals congregate here at here to walk around, and also visit the near by catholic church, nothing special.

Plaza de Armas. It was beautiful place
There are so many travelers, stores such as restaurnat , suvenir shop and so on

Beautiful City Center!. This plaza is full of life. We spent hours people watching from Calle del Medio with pisco sours in hand. It is ideal to sit in and take in the beautiful surrounding architecture or watch the the spectrum of people that come to visit. It is kept very clean. I enjoyed walking through it daily.

Relax. A perfect place to just sit and watch everything go by. Stop relax and enjoy the old town both day and night, watch the sunset and enjoy the Cathedral at night. Plenty of old restaurants, try the back alleys and find some memorable experiences. You must try Guinea pig and enjoy its moist flavoursome meat.
Glorious!. Enjoyed it by day and by night! Children playing soccer, people watching, artists, local dogs, very interesting. Beautiful landscaping, fountain, monuments!

Plaza de Armas amazing. Just beautiful. There a free guided walking tours available or downloadable self guided walking apps to learn some more of the history of the plaza. The view from Bhagdad restaurant is amazing. Wear closed in shoes as the cobble stones get a bit much for sandals / thongs. Bring a rain jacket or buy a cheap plastic poncho as the weather changes rapidly. Dress in layers for the same reason. You will love this place. PS many shopfronts hide courtyards behind them with even more shopss inside. Well worth exploring. Take care at night, use common sense.

The centre of Cusco. If you're visiting Cusco you will undoubtedly cisit Plaza de Armas. Go in to the cathedral; it's worth a look as is the church to the left. Nice bars & restaurants on the plaza but beware of tourist trap prices, although to be honest you'd have to try pretty hard to find a super expensive place in Cusco...

Colonial Beauty. The overtake by the Spaniards is somewhat epitomized by this place with the Spanish architecture and religious presence surrounding the great Inca Pachacuti. The area is well maintained and beautifully encapsulated by the mountains in the background.

Plaza De arma. Stayed in the square at hotel Santa Maria. So just a short walk
Breathtakingly beautiful. As my friend mentioned to me while having a meal from a balcony looking down on the square. I feel like crying it's so beautiful. Stayed in cusco longer than we anticipated due to the beauty. And very friendly people. And so much to do.

Great Place. Lot of shops and restaurants with churches for those who wish a quiet moment. I enjoyed the Gardens there. So peaceful. A great view can be had from any one of the terraces or balconies of the Restaurants.

Of course - beautiful. The center of the city, the heart of celebrations, happenings, surrounded by churches, hoteks and important buildings. In the center there is a great neat garden and the inevitable fountain... It's pretty, it's happening it's a must.

Interesting town square. Really enjoyed spending time here just "people watching". From the locals to the multitude of visitors. The variety of architecture surrounding the area is also very interesting.

Great carnival parade. We saw something link 40 dance groups with bands dance their way along the top of the plaza this morning. Half way through the heavens opened so we took refuge in a bar and watched from the terrace until it really did rain. 50% of the crowd remained to see the soaked dancers. Later on we watched from a restaurant terrace.Plenty of shops and restaurant/bars around the plaza along with the cathedral and churches to visit.

Nothing special. Nice square and largely pedestrian which is nice, but for me not quite as atmospheric as say Arequipa. Dominated by Cathedral as usual, but not much else. Seems to have a nice buzz of locals and tourists.

Start your tour of Cusco HERE!. Beautiful plaza surrounded by restaurants and cathedrals. Great atmosphere and the center of town. Lots of other attractions literally a block away. Beware b/c of the popularity, plenty of street merchants hawking wares. Popular amongst tourists and locals.

Beautiful Plaza. Centre and heart of Cusco. It's a large, vibrant plaza with many activities happening around. Great to sit and watch life going on around you. The colonial architecture has been well maintained (generally) and gives you a sense of what life was like in Spanish colonial days. Great statues, park and surrounded by many bars and restaurants mostly overpriced. I found Le Papillon in the corner next to the cathedral which was a great place to sip on a cocktail and watch life go by in the Plaza below. At night, the lights of the City twinkle like the Milky Way.
A wonderful central plaza - one of the best I've seen. Lots of great restaurants, wonderful shops, and a great place to people watch. Now open to pedestrians only daytimes.

Beautiful historical are. The Plaza de Armas is gorgeous day and night, even in the rainy season. The only annoying part is the promoters and street salesmen bugging you 24/7. Aside from that, it is beautiful, clean, safe, and makes for great photos.
Very beautiful. Very beautiful colonial style buildings all around the square, neat lawn, tidy foot-pathes. We like this part of Cuzco most.

Amazing sights any time of the day or night. From the fountain in the centre to the historical 360 degree views and the central location to the other sites in the city, this place is amazing. My favorite time here is at night with all the house lights on the surrounding mountains, I nicknamed it my city in the stars.

we would like to be more time. relaxing here was the most outstanding thing we could do, but to have a nice sunny day on a rainy season was the best for us...we liked eveything here in cusco, gonna come back next year.

Centre of Cusco. Central plaza of Cusco. Lots of shops and eateries, and the Cathedral. Great day out. Plenty to see. Try the Inka Grill and Maps for a good meal. Inka Grill do a very nice Alpaca steak. Can recommend.

must not miss the plaza, although the peddlers are annoying. It's the heart of colonial Cusco and offers impressive views of the cathedral and another main church. There are lots of hostels right there, as well as a few dining options. What I did not appreciate--neither in 2008 during my first visit nor now, in Feb. 2016--was the many peddlers who try to sell trips, drugs, and massages.
"Excellent". Cuzco is a beautiful city full of tradition , his place is cozy , is always full of tourists and people are friendly.
Historic. Historic churches and numerous restaurants. Especially beautiful at night. Very nice when the small carnival groups come through at the weekends.

Nice place to relax. I sat on the bench and just people watched while I finished my breakfast. It is just a nice place to be, to sit and relax and be submerged in a place so different from home. The view in the morning and at night is totally different. There are also lots of nice places to eat around the area.

Historic Churches, Center of City. Everything in Cusco, especially directions on getting around, relates to the Plaza de Armas. There are two historic churches on th square, the Cathedral, built above an Inca temple, and La Compania, the Jesuit church. The Cathedral is vast, with high altars, statues, and beautiful architecture. There is a guided tour, worth taking. The jaw-dropping feature of La Compania is gold. Lots of it. The high altar with its retablos and gold is unmatched anywhere in my experience. I had read elsewhere that the Plaza was full of hawkers and unofficial 'guides', but that was not our experience. There are lots of tourist police and traffic police in the Plaza area, so it is perfectly safe and a nice place to get your bearings. The tourist police are also helpful with directions.

Large square. There are some attractive flower beds in the centre of the square which is overlooked by the splendid cathedral on one side. Traffic whizzes around on all sides. Shops, restaurants and cafes occupy the buildings on the sides.
worth a visit. must visit, especially at night, nice restaurants surrounding streets, lovelly church and little streets

City Center (near everything). This lovely plaza is great at night, the local "tourist police" keep it safe and it is near great dining, shops, ATMs and money changers. The lighting is perfect for photo's in the evening. The ATMs limit your withdrawals to $200 (a few will give you $300), so plan ahead. I would get money, then visit the money changers to get some small bills. At night you are less likely to be pestered by the street vendors, but with recommendation from our guide I purchased an excellent book from a street vendor. She had written it and it gave a wonderful insight to Cuscu, Machu Picchu and an overview of Peru.

The sellers are a negative.. The plaza was a beautiful place to sit for a few and take a bit of a rest and people watch, The fountain,church and cathedral all provide good photo ops as well, the only real down side for me was that itseemed like every 2 minutes someone was trying to sell us something or wanted to clean my shoes. Wemuch preferred the plaza in Huarocondo (where we stayed) as you could sit there all day and no onetried to sell us anything, had a few locals want to talk, but no souvenir peddlers.
Beautiful Plaza. A visit to Cusco surely involves seeing Plaza de Armas. It's beautiful, with loads to see and do in the vicinity. Plenty of bars and restaurants.

Pretty historical plaza in the middle of it all. This plaza won't knock your socks off or anything, but it's a nice quiet place in the middle of the tourist part of town. A couple of restaurants have balcony seating that makes for a pleasant evening watching the hills light up at night. It's also good people, and dog, watching

Tourist centre - so many hawkers. This is very touristy, but so quite and peaceful. It's also well maintained, safe and so many of police/security around. Just stay away from the hawkers. ATMs around this area charge extraordinary fees. Restaurants are also very expensive. It's really good to enjoy the weather and have a drink around this area.

Center of Incan World and Socializing for Visitors. Great central location to start exploring the cultural treasures of the Incas, mingling with the locals or watching all sizes, ages,shapes and nationalities of visitors. You can feel the energy of the place from the ancient buildings and the many visitors passing through.

Pictureque Plaza full of hawkers. There's no doubt the Plaza is very picturesque with it's perimeter of large colonial buildings but unfortunately it is heavily populated with hawkers selling everything from dodgy tours to photos with baby lambs. They are very persistent and quite annoying, although I understand they are attempting to make a living. The main activity here is to take the quintessential 'been to cusco' photos - such as one of the cathedral with the central fountain in the foreground. There are a few bars which you can frequent and it's pretty safe at all hours of the day. As a side note I wouldn't recommend going into the cathedral - it's overpriced at 25Sol and pretty underwhelming although for further details on that check out my other review.

You could spend days here. The cathedral, the bell tower and the museums. We particularly enjoyed the Inka museum. It is right off the square and inexpensive. Wonderful exposition. Nice places to eat. There is a people watching square. Must see when in the area.

Beautiful plaza, lots of hawkers. The central plaza is beautiful, but touristy to a fault. It is lined with tour consolidators offering internet, money exchange, and tours. Know they will not be running your tour and make a commission on your purchase. Additionally, I was approached by a constant stream of hawkers selling everything from coca candy to tour tickets. They are just trying to make a living, but it did get frustrating.
Center of Cusco. Be sure to see this photo op plazas and the historic churches at the plaza and museums and streets with many signs of the former inca capital city

here you can shof off. to be here and not meet other people is like to be at the fontana of trevi in rome and not throw some coins at it taking snapshots to remember it, i met a nice girl from new zealand here that accepted me to accompany her on her tour.
Great place to chill. Very beautiful square. You can sit in one of the benches and appreciate the architecture of the churches. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants around it.
nice place to rest and watch. i liked to sit down and watch the world and time pass by, especially after coming from a trek or after walking around the city, it is a nice place to see and be seen.
a good place to visit. in cuzco you have to walk all around the main plaza, take a map at the hotel and start walking, and make stop for a good beer i recommend CUZQUEÑA light beer

Lambretta101. Hmmm, Yes Plaza de Armas is good.I spent time here during three separate stays in Cusco as I used it as my hub. The plaza is pleasant, nice to sit and chill while people watching with some decent pubs and restaurants around the square. Prices are higher here compared to other parts of Cusco.Churches, check, if your into Catholic Churches. Personally I'd rather experience the Inca culture while in Peru instead of a colonial powers system of subjugating the indigenous people..... and, if you want to see Catholic Churches, visit Italia ; Firenze, Venezia to suggest a couple.Back to Plaza de Armas...., very touristy, drug dealers offering Cocaine and weed ad every turn (although not pushy with it and easily told to bolt).Decent bars are Norton and Paddys to the right of the main church.Any ways, you can't go to Cusco and not wander round this Plaza, some will love it others will find it pleasant if not overly inspiring, I fall into the latter.If you find yourself here however, your going to have a ball as there will be so much more to see and experience during your travels.
beautiful. The best way to enjoy the architecture of Cusco. The acces to get their is quite easy. The two churches are beautiful at the sunrise...and all day long
An epic way to ring in the New Year!. Fireworks from all around, spraying champagne bottles, and people racing around the square... It made for a perfect way to ring in 2016!

the point of reference. Everybody stops here for a while and I say .... it is an extraordinary TREFFPUNKT where people from all over the world meet and chat. If you come here alone, you can make good friends here.

Beautiful Plaza. Lovely picturesque plaza with 360 degree views of churches. The fountain is quite lovely as well. A must
T see in Cusco.
A great gathering place. This is simply a huge square, with restaurants, bars, shops and two large cathedrals surrounding. The traffic is crazy and not particularly pedestrian friendly, but safe.
Lively center of life. The plaza is flanked by the cathedral, another church, and lots of shops and restaurants. There's also a variety of travel agencies for booking tours to Machupicchu, etc.

Interesting to Walk Around. We arrived after new years so we didn't have to deal with very large crowds at any time. There were many offers for alpaca products that may or may not have been real. The only thing the police seemed to be doing was shooing peddlers away.

Anchor point. This Plaza will be your anchor point for navigating the city... It is a very nice Plaza and well maintained, surrounded by restaurants, pubs and shops (though I'd recommend getting a block or two away from the Plaza for food and drinks). prepare to be bombarded by locals trying to sell their wares as well, although they are relatively polite compared to those in many other countries.
Nice central plaza. A great place to stroll around on ur visit to Cusco. It has lots of shops and restaurants. We try organic greens and cafe moreno and both had great food.

Nice place but too touristic. The plaza itself is really nice in the historical center of Cuzco. But besides the cathedral direct at it all around there are shops, banks and tourist agencies and everybody asks you to buy something. This makes it very uncomfortable walking around.

Central focus of Cusco. The Plaza de Armas is dominated by Cusco Cathedral and the almost equally massive La Compania or Jesuits' Church. Both these buildings contain some amazing religious art, including many examples from the seventeenth century Cusco School in which local Indian and mestizo art blends with Spanish art. You may well see flags flying in the square, including the rainbow-striped Quechua Indian flag. Surrounding the square are some arcades containing souvenir shops and restaurants.

In Cusco? Must see Plaza de Armas. This is the central plaza in Cuzco - shops, restaurants, beautiful church, etc. The place really gets fun after dark - people are everywhere, walking around, going to shops and restaurants. I was there with my 11 year old son and we enjoyed (and felt safe) walking around at night checking out the scene. Neither of us speak Spanish, but we got along fine as many people speak English. There are a lot of street vendors - take your time, talk to the people, many are artists and have interesting stories to tell.

New Year's Eve - Groped and Robbed at the Plaza des Armas. While the Plaza des Armas itself is beautiful, and people watching can be a great time during the day, I was sadly very disappointed with the experience I had on New Year's Eve. I had actually specifically ensured I'd be in Cusco for New Year's Eve, to be able to experience the festivities, crowd and fireworks at the Plaza Des Armas that I had heard so much about. I also wanted to do my 12 running tours around the plaza at midnight for good luck for the year to come.Unfortunately, when it came down to it, the crowds were overwhelming. My friend and were not drinking, and could not find anywhere at all that was open past 11pm to serve coffee, undoubtedly because the crowds were unruly and overbearing for the restaurants and cafes surrounding the square. There was little to no safety for people standing around, my friend and I were almost hurt by large scale fireworks being set off incorrectly in the middle of the crowd more than once. Folks are setting off firecrackers everywhere, including right at your feet when you aren't looking.At midnight, we attempted to start the tour around the square with the mob of people, but I found myself being sexually groped, shoved, and ultimately I had my purse unzipped and my wallet and cell phone stolen, within the space of a few minutes in the crowd. My friend and I pushed our way out, approached the police, and were told there was nothing that could be done, unfortunately. So, ultimately, like so many other people before, I have learned my lesson about crowds like these and carrying money or cell phones at those kinds of times, and that no one can really be safe in a mob of people. Hopefully somebody reading this will think twice before making the same mistake I did!

When I wanted to be watched on. When you feel you are the center of the world in the navel of the world, this is the place to be...I was here for nearly 3 hours and I met a lot of people from everywhere which were going to everywhere...a nice place to stroll
Very lively place . Very happening anytime of the day.. Especially on Christmas and New Years.. Had a great time. Walk around, sit relax. Anything u wanna do.. U can do it here. Love Cusco

Wonderful square with shops and restaurants.. We just stayed one block from Plaza de Armas. The square has lots of attractions including fast food, trendy restaurants, a couple fantastic cathedrals, good shops, cash machines, Starbucks. Plenty of sitting and people watching. The square is level, easy walking. If it's raining the inside sidewalk perimeter is covered by upper stories of buildings. Tons to do within blocks of square as well.

I realized that I am not alone .... At least you can feel you belong to the global community when you rest here after your trek or you only stay for a little of suntanning.....well, if your skin is so white like mine.

Great history. This is a great venue. Very safe. Great restaurants and shopping. You can get local fair, Irish pub or Starbucks. (Do go to Starbucks) the cathedrals are beautiful. Lots of policia which around to make you feel secure. Friendly place. Beautiful at Christmas.
Try Cyu!. By definition, the guinea pig (Cavia porcellus), also called the cavy or domestic guinea pig. Anyway, it was unique with a small portion of meat. One thing you want to try it anyway.

Beautiful and historic. Here you can feel many things important have happened. The most beautiful Plaza de Armas in América, rivaling with the Zócalo in México and the Plaza de Armas in Lima. Squared by beautiful stone churches, four in total. You get a glimpse of how important was the religuous war between spaniards and incas.
Another beautiful Plaza. Every time you turn a corner into a plaza you are never disappointed. This is yet another impressive plaza.
Centre of the city. It was full of people somebody selling something or the other, you can click pictures with the peruvian ladies who carry small sheep. they are little cute creatures.

Beautiful Square-especially at night. One of the classic playa de armas bounded by two massive and historic churches and a nice square. Lined with shops and restaurants on two sides makes is less appealing but nice structure in and of itself. Everytime time you pass the square and you will alot traversing the town you will enjoy the space especially from the church steps surrounded by the hills of cusco.

Memorable!. you have to spend time here at night! we saw a just married couple coming out of the cathedral, then walked around the plaza. I loved the energy, the street vendors, the musicians. It was great

Nice place to sit. It's nice to sit in the square, and admire the view (churches, fountain), and we were even able to witness a ceremonial dance through the streets (seemed to be a wedding!) with locals all dressed in traditional wear. I'd avoid the restaurants on the square though (tourist traps!), and there are lots of vendors but they are not overly pushy. Although there are few too many people trying to sell massages...

Best Plaza de Armas. Seemed no matter what time of day something interesting was happening. Go with the idea of strolling and sitting and strolling some more. I can't imagine it would be long before a procession marches by. Just great fun!
Great on New Years Eve.. Music, people and festivities on New Years Eve.Plenty of restaurants, many changers and hostels all around.
Central Location. Go here for any thing or every thing. May it be food, tours, shopping or money exchange. All kinds of great restaurants and great shopping experiences.
Fun city center. Great area to get food and to sit and people watch. Restaurants line the entire square and there are many shops to buy souvenirs, last minute trek items, or to exchange money.

Beautiful architecture and park. The heart of Cusco is the Plaza de Armas, a large green space with a fountain and benches where locals and tourists both hang out. Surrounding it are a selection of restaurants, shops and Spanish-era architecture - the Cathedral, the Basilica, the convent, etc. and they are beautiful to explore but also serve as a stunning skyline.
Pretty nice square, but not much more. Center of town and of tourist life in Cusco. Good place to hang out but too many salesmen unfortunately.
Neat town center. We were there on Christmas Eve, when the markets were going on. Many street stalls with artists and locals selling their goods. Neat to see.

Central Square. This is the central square in Cuzco. It is surrounded by shops, restaurants and cathedrals. It is absolutely beautiful. Full of life and energy. It was was fun sitting on a bench one evening people watching as the hikers/tourists and the people of Cuzco intermixed and enjoyed their evening.

Really nice plaza. Busy, bustling, lots of vendors and great restaurants in the area.
Make sure to check it out while in Cusco.

Plaza de Armas, the heart of beautiful Cusco. As anyone who has been to Cusco will tell you, it's a beautiful city, filled with historical buildings, museums, shops, restaurants, tourists & more shops! And Plaza de Armas is at the heart of this gorgeous city. And like most places in South America, it's very safe. The name 'Plaza de Armas' literally means "Warrior Square" & you will find one in many South American cities. In Cusco, this plaza has been the scene of several important events in the history of this city, such as the proclamation by the Spanish conquistador, Francisco Pizarro, when the Spanish conquered Cusco. Tragically, it was the scene of the death of Túpac Amaru II, considered the indigenous leader of the Inca resistance.The square is dominated by the main Cathedral & the Church of La Compañía, together with stone arcades, built by the Spanish. Today, most of these arcades are restaurants or high end shops. We actually found that there were better restaurants located off the plaza, but it's nice to try one of them out for lunch & sit on the balcony & watch the world go by down below
Amazing Cusco. Great place to visit at night with your family and friends.i was there 4 months ago, walking with my family

Highlight of Cusco. This is where all the tourists are. This is also where all the best restaurants are located. The high end, over-priced trinkets are here too, best to shop in the San Pedro Market. But this is the best place to stay as many of the tours use this area for pick-up and drop-off.

Perfection. I simply love Cusco, I could spend another week here and still there would be things to see!! The constructions are amazing! I totally recommend it for everyone, it's a must while in Cusco

Impressive, but overly touristy. Cusco has such a rich history and impressive architecture, which together with its role as "feeder town" to Machu Picchu has made it a compelling draw for international tourists...Sadly though the race for tourist dollars has meant that its turning into some sort of South American "Las Vegas" where the gaudiness and the hucksters start to take over...

Nice plaza to hang out and have a meal . Very nice plaza designed along Spanish town planning with an astounding plaza surround indeed by large churches, government buildings and grand buildings to wow the conquered local population to encourage them to be subsumed to them. 500 years later, the plaza still wows tourists . It is well preserved compared to the dilapidated state in Lima of their plaza and is much safer than that in Lima. Suggest that visitors grab a table at the square and enjoy the views. Vehicle free traffic ensures that the plaza is tourist friendly.

Beautiful Plaza. Beautiful plaza surrounded by lots of great restaurants and bars. Lots of street vendors selling souvenirs but they aren't pushy at all like you find in many cities. Very friendly people and great scenery.

Clean, Friendly!. We were fortunate to visit right at Christmas, so the special market was open today. The Plaza was filled with the scent of fresh herbs, and there were many vendors with unique items I hadn't seen at any other market in my 4 day visit. I didn't purchase anything so I don't know if the prices were fair.The big thing to watch for here is something really special. There are free walking tours of Cusco. If you go in the next few months especially, look for Eric. He's a very funny, sweet local man who speaks fluent English, and Spanish, and he only works for tips. He shows you some really amazing local artisans and shops, as well as local landmarks and shares some great history. His tour ends with a free sample of Pisco Sour that he makes himself at an amazing local restaurant called Unpi. I have also rated this place.

You will find somethings. Well it's a place you def have to visit, you have restaurants 🍴 bars, ice cream and today and tomorrow for Christmas 🎄 they have locals showing hand crafted ornamentals also traditional clothes.. The picture is from behind of plaza de Armas..
Nice Plaza. This is a nice plaza to walk around. Lots of restaurants, shopping and sights to see. I recommend it as part of a walking tour

Its a very nice place. The square has many restaurants and beautiful architecture. Mcdonalds and KFC are there too!
At night you can get a few crazies around but police were about too so we felt safe.

Beautiful and relaxing . This is the place to be in Cusco. We visited during the day and at night. The flowers and lawn are beautiful here. The clouds were also beautiful surrounding the plaza. Great photo op. We saw several parades here as they have a variety of parades and processions starting in the area. In the evenings we saw people and dogs just hanging out by the fountain or on the benches. We didn't really eat at the restaurants too close to the plaza though as we found better places just a few blocks away.

Great Food Selection & Cathedral Tour. The plaza was full of life and excitement during our trip; the local soccer team had a parade through the streets one night, and we visited after going to dinner and the whole city was still alive late into the evening.The museum tour that our guide gave us of the cathedral was quite informative, and gave us more insight into the relationship that the Spanish had with the Andean people of the area regarding religious and social conflict. On a purely aesthetic level, the cathedral was magnificent.
Social center. What a beautiful place.center of historic cusco.surrounded by lots of restaurants and locally made craft stores.vibrant and full of life

Lovely part of the city. I love this part of the city; there is a fountain, cathedral and beautiful architecture. There are many eateries here, including Starbucks and Macdonald. Good place for people watching and pretty safe with police presence. You may take photos of the ladies in traditional dress but give them tips.

Gorgeous, Many things to do around. This plaza is breathtaking, especially now that they prohibited all cars and motorized traffic from entering the plaza. It is beautiful at all times of the day, each one giving you a different taste and color of the plaza. Great for people watching, great for chilling at one of the balconies of restaurants and bars. My favorite thing to do is chill here on a Sunday from the morning as there will always be something happening throughout the day. Wethere it be a parade, live music, food and drink samples, art exhibits, fashion shows, etc. At night, it's the safest place to be, with many bars and clubs around and always taxis and police. If you want to party and drink for free, at nights there will be people handing out free drink passes from all the local clubs around the plaza, collect several of them and start visiting clubs and bars! :)

Marking point in Cusco. Very good place as a marking point,...to shop, to look for restaurants, to look for hotels, to look for travel agencies, and at night for people who likes bar hopping this is a good place, literally close to everything. Or just take a walk in the plaza, find a bench to sit and rest awhile after a whole day walk of shopping. For those who would try to find Mcdonald or Starbucks, it's in line with the Cathedral that's facing the whole plaza. Everything is in this area.

Gathering point. We arrived here from Aguas Calientas around 8pm and came through the plaza on the way to our hotel. It looks lovely lit up at night. There was a public demonstration/protest during our visit.
City center Cusco. We enjoyed a brief walk thru this part of Cusco. There are several churches and a museum well worth the visit. We spent over an hour in the Museo Inka

Cusco Town center. This is like any other town center that you will find in many parts of Peru. Lots of shops and activities. Good restaurants, for those from US there is a Starbucks here. Cusco Cathedral is situated here.
Best Plaza in the city.. All the action is here, day and night. The square is original and very historic with many great restaurants and stores in the area. Start your trip from here.
beautiful. just walked around took pictures not that much around find the double decker bus take that to see cusco. plenty of restaurants .
Very nice square in the heart of Cusco.. Very busy but nice looking square in the heart of downtown Cusco, offers many shops, banks, restaurants, etc.

Beautiful, Clean & Safe. Plaza de Armas in Cusco was a fantastic spot to just sit on the Cathedral steps and take it all in. The fountain is surrounded by beautiful streets and restaurants. Go by the Choco Museum or walk to San Pedro Market. It is a great place to be both day and night. There are also several bars, dance clubs, and Hookah bars only a few steps away. The Hebrew restaurant's Falafel is AMAZING.

City Centre. I initially thought this is an attraction but it turns out that it is the city centre.Its a nice place to book local tours and you'll get really good deals compared to the tourist operators at the Cusco Airport.

Impressive and Safe Place. I visited here with my wife. The atmosphere surrounded by Cathedrals and ancient architectures were unusual and the fountain and the relaxed tourists and locals made me comfortable. There were still lots of people with lots under bright lights in the square, and here was safe even in the night time.I recommend drinking beers or juices on the 2nd floor at the pubs around this square, then you can see the whole of the square and the mountains and hills filled with brown colored houses.

Lovely place to wonder around. This Plaza wasn’t far from out hotel so we had an opportunity to have a good look around; there are plenty of shops and restaurant all over the place. Be care that you don’t take a photograph of the ladies in the traditional dress with out permission, as they charge $$ for the photo.I very nice place to visit.

Great Energy here...Loved it.. Great view of Cristo Blanco...Good Food in every directionwe Loved walking over to the Plaza de Armas from our hotel just to hang on one of the benches and people watch while we enjoyed a cigar and a coke...it's a fun festive atmosphere always...the kids selling souvenirs are priceless and very good at it...they all speak good English and were fun to talk to..."One Soles to look"...LOL"You buy now!"... no thank you..."why you no buy now??? :(:(:( "... (with a very sad face)and my personal favorite the Jedi child... "You buy?", ...No,"Yes.", ... NO, "Yessss.", ...uhh NO... LOL... Jedi child."Yesssssssss!"All yes' in a quiet whisper-like voice...LOL

Fabulous Square, spend hours entertained. This plaza was the best part of Cusco, besides the shopping. You could literally grab a bottle of wine and just sit and watch from this square for hours. Great views with two cathedrals, along with restaurants and shops aligning the streets. Beautiful fountain to be the centerpiece. One of my favorite plazas in the world. Quaint and perfect!

GO to Paddy's Pub, avoid Nathans.. We ate at Paddys, OK, we drank too. THe Cusquena Beer is OK. THe Shepards pie, and Quesadias and soup are all first class. Very friendly atmosphere, full of Westerners, a little slow, because they are so busy.

Agreeably Plaza. Beautiful Plaza! Is clean and the grounds are well kept. You are not allowed to walk on the grass, which is good! The fountain is also nice. On Sunday's if you go early you can see the army marches around the plaza. Be there before 9 am, is busy and than all the locals come out to the city.

Cusco Travels. Another great and safe, clean plaza with shops along the perimeter. There were a lot of street dogs in the plaza and that seems to be the norm in this area. They are very friendly and do not bother the tourists.
A Must spot to visit. This is one of those plazas where you need to visit, find a spot to sit and just relax the night away.
the beautyfull square. relaxing and beautyfull square. nice gardens with beautyfull flowers and roses...lots of turists from all over the world
Very Nice Place. It is a very beautiful place, but as a tourist it is impossible to enjoy because of all of the street vendors, I am not into religion so the 2 churches offend me.
Central piazza. Located in the heart of Cusco this very attractive public space is surrounded by attractive buildings including the not to be missed fabulous cathedral

A nice plaza in the heart of Cusco. As night falls the houses that were scattered around the mountain areas lit up and became like stars against the silhouette of the Andes. The town centre would be crowded by pedestrians. Police were always visible so we felt safe. The stone walkway made plaza de armas cozy to walk, and the beautiful churches and fountain were captivating when we arrived there for the first time. Every road from the plaza are lanes filled with restaurants and hidden jewels like museums and colonial churches.
Fun Plaza. This very active Plaza was in walking distance from our hotel, it has museums, shops, restaurants, and even a Starbucks that surround the Plaza.
A fun area to walk around. This area in downtown Cusco is fun to walk around. There are many shops and restaurants in the area to enjoy while you're there.

One of the best square in South Americe. It's classical piece of square with great cathedral and other historical buildings and central park. In the night has atmosphere, which you will remember for a long time.
Beautiful at Night!. Beautiful plaza to stroll through with many restaurants and shops. Just beware, you will be constantly hounded by people selling Cusco souvenirs!

Beautiful plaza with plenty of restaurants and shops. Cusco is very tourist friendly with myriad restaurants and shops and some nice crafts and art in the side streets. Truly enjoyed our three days here.

The main center of Cusco - and a "must see" for all travelers --. This is the main hub of Cusco, a large plaza surrounded by unique shops, amazing restaurants and lovely churches and museums. There is always activity here - whether it's the nightlife or the days where vendors set up their stalls and there's always something to see. Highly recommend including this in your Cusco plans.

Great Plaza. Our first introduction to the city was to walk around this magnificent plaza and the surrounding streets and shops. Great place with very happy people throughout, shoe-shiners who laughingly told me superglue would be more suitable. Lovely reload atmosphere in the plaza with magnificent buildings surrounding it.

Beautiful!. V nice place, lots of people. Beautiful church!
Great shops and restaurants around :)
Money exchange places too.

Beautiful central square. This beautiful central square is not just a place to look at but it's where people who live in Cusco go. It's lined with a cathedral, some fancy shops and is a pleasant place to walk around.

Historical Plaza with Wonderful Churches. Plaza de Armas is gorgeous! The historical churches are amazing and the exquisite surroundings make for a million fun photo-ops. There are tons of restaurants and shops - from fast food chains to fine dining - all catering to the touristy crowd. The only negative is the hawkers - the artists who try to sell you their art and jewelry & the restaurant helpers who try to get you to eat at their establishment. I know they are trying to make a living, but they do not seem to understand when you really are not going to buy their items or go to their restaurant. They are way to aggressive.

Center of the Colonial Section. This lovely square is surrounded by history. The business definitely cater to the tourist. Restaurants and souvenir shops abound. The churches anchor the views.Always bustling, the area is full of local color: women weaving and hoping to sell you some of their work. Buskers hoping for a tip. Photo ops with llamas and goats (for a small fee, of course). Not to be missed.

Another great square. Surrounded by top restaurants & tour agencies.
Relaxing & energetic at the same time. If you are watching your budget, venture less than 1 block & the prices drop by up to 80%!

Prettiest at night. A fun & bustling square both during the day & at night, but for photos - the night ones turn out very special. We found better restaurants - both price & quality slightly away from the plaza.

Beautiful Square with amazing History all around. The square is nice, mostly because of the amazing history surrounding it. The roads around it have traffic restrictions in place, keeping the noise down and the air clear.A lot of photo ops with locals wearing traditional dress, children and baby alpacas. They make a living posing for pictures. Beware, they usually are in groups of two to four and eager to pose in a group. That met every one expects a tip. You cannot tip one and tell them to share...
Beautiful historic place. Very peaceful and beautiful plaza. Plenty of shops and restaurants around. It is your classical Spanish style plaza.

So beautiful!. Loved visiting the Plaze de Armas. I really enjoyed just sitting on the benches and enjoying how beautiful it is. There was a small parade going on when I was there, it was fun to watch. The churches there are beautiful and worth a visit as well.
Nice Plaza. Nice Plaza all the Clubs and Bars and good restaurants are around this Plaza and the Cathedral is beautiful worth a visit its like the center of Cusco
Great place!. Great place to fine some place to eat! Very picturesque with the fountain and churches. Also to shop and even get a back massage.

Exciting spanish influenced main square. This square dating from the 1500s is a center of activity for not only tourists, but locals alike. There are 2 large cathedrals fronting the square and several hotels are within 2 blocks. Restaurants can be found everywhere around here. It is an enjoyable place to just sit for a while and people watch. I always felt safe around here, even late at night.
Nice historic buildings, ok shopping, good restaurants. We spent a bit of time here, and there are quite a bit of attractions around the plaza, as well as places to eat / get a coffee.
Beautiful. Lovely place to visit day or night. Always lots happening and great sites to visit close by. Good to use as a central spot to navigate the city centre.
Beautiful during Day and Night. This is the main historic area of Cuzco. People gather here during the day and night. The lights at night make this place look beautiful.

Beautiful city square!. The fountain and lights at night were absolutely beautiful. Lots of restaurants and shops. You will definitely get a lot of locals coming up to you trying to sell you all sorts of things.
Beautiful plaza. One of the most beautiful plazas in Peru ! Amazing view of the mountains, of the cathedral with its ancient houses. It feels good to just sit around and feel the atmosphere.
Beautiful both day and night.. Center of activity for both locals and tourists. Lots of churches, resturaunts, tourist shops and tour venders in this area for you to choose from.

a central view for watching life pass by in Cusco. Find a bench; sit on the curb or grass or by the fountain. Just watch life unfold in front of you. You may see a demonstration; hear musicians, watch lovers walk hand-in-hand, or simply see hoards of tourists. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants that ring the plaza so when you're ready for a break, there is a wide range of places to sit and eat and/or drink to your heart's content.
Spend your evening here. Like all squares in Peru/Bolivia, its the heartbeat of the town. You'll see most of the great architecture in here or withing a 100 yards. Very peaceful.

the hub of activity in cusco . this place is busy all day and night. you will get mobbed by people trying to sell you stuff, worse than the beaches is Mexico, but most go away after ten minutes. the plaza has a few restaurants and bars around it, lots of tour sellers, and lots of souvenir shops. the process of everything here is more than elsewhere, but the sellers so more sales than anywhere else. it's a cool place to just hang out and people watch.

Busy Plaza. It's a lovely plaza with nice scenery. There are a few people wandering around trying to sell you trinkets but when you say no they don't really hassle you again. It's a nice place for a walk and to see the various types of architecture.
Lovely day and night. Sat here on several occasions and despite being asked to buy things quite a bit it is still nice to sit, watch and take in the scenery. Night time is rather beautiful.

Center of the City. This is the very center og the city. Very beautiful !I would give it exellent if they would do something about those annoying sellers.In all the historical center there are taxi drivers honking and honking that you might want a taxi.. At least here should be a place to relax (as there are no green parks in the center). you seat on the bench having a conversation or just having a rest.. and every second someone bothers you. At first you say no gracias and keep enjoying yourself.. but then come another and they make noise to get your attention and wouldn´t go before ask you a few times again.Souvenirs, falls cigarettes, trvel agencies promoters, restaurants promoters, shoes cleaning (they are the worst), charity and even drug sellers.Also there are some that seat next to you telling there story and then asking for ´propina´(Tip!)..To shame they don´t do enough to stop them from bothering the tourists.. the officers who are in charg of that just whistles at them (what annoying even more)and they move on to the next victim..
Great Square to Check Out!. This historic square is a great place to people watch and relax. There are plenty of historical places to visit and the architecture is beautiful.
Such a fun and busy plaza. Lots to see everyday in this plaza because she is the heart of the city. We were there during Halloween and the local children had so much fun.

Best time to see and stroll during a strike. Usually, this plaza is filled with tourists, shoeshine boys, hawkers of jewelry, paintings, hats, gloves, photos. There is even a man with a selfie stick to take your photo. However, there was a two-day strike of municipal workers, taxi drivers, bus drivers, protesting the government proposal to privatize all the patrimonial sites (I sympathized with them!) and the plaza was quiet, except for a few speakers on the steps to the cathedral. It was a joy to stroll and appreciate the Spanish/Moorish architecture and the fountain with the Quechua Great Inka (who gave his name to the entire people). It is beautifully kept with flower gardens surrounding the "square" and on Sundays, there is no vehicle traffic around the square, which should be the rule 7 days a week!

Lovely place to hang out!. As always, the plaza del armas is a great place to be in south american cities. Although Cusco is a big city, the atmosphere is great here. Lots of restaurants and coffee places to relax. Touristy also because of all the local women with little goats asking for photo's.

Beautiful Historic Square . A few hours after arriving in Cusco (and after a couple of cups of Coca Tea and a rest to acclimate a bit to the elevation), we headed to the Square which was a short 10 min walk from our hotel.It's beautiful. The architecture is amazing and the diversity of shops and restaurants is what you'd expect from a central tourist attraction. Pedlars selling cheap art and massages will eventually drive you nuts however, generally, a firm "no" sends them the next passerby. Keep your valuables tucked away because I watched as young kids appeared to scope out unsuspecting tourists walking with too much camera gear in hand.. I don't know what the end result was, but be careful. North American and European tourists represent a vast amount of wealth to many of the locals and easy targets WILL be taken advantage of..Many of the shops sell what appear to be knock off alpaca items and art however stick to the higher end shops where the cheapo souvenirs can't be found and it's more likely that the "baby alpaca scarf" is in fact the real deal..Bring your camera and some small change.. Lots of pics to be taken!

Watch Cusco culture walk past. . Plaza de Armas is where to come and watch Cusco's vibrant culture wander by. Many nice places to eat or drink while people watching the plaza activity. Also, two major cathedrals are right on the plaza. If you don't visit the plaza, you haven't seen Cusco.

The place to be in Cusco. Beautiful spot in Cusco where everyone is hanging out and there are tons of different things going on. In this city center, you can go on Catherdral tours, have drinks on a rooftop to overlook the view, or simply walk around and take in the sites. This is the place to be when you're in Cusco and you do not want to miss it.
Great place to hang out. A busy place to hang out. There are many stores and restaurants around the park. Since Cusco is situated in high altitude, the sun is hot when just sitting around.
Nice place to people watch. It's the center of town. A nice place to people watch. It's a bit touristy though. Go down some side streets to find magical local places.

The place to stay in Cusco. Try and stay as close to the plaza as possible, it is very clean, safe and in the heart of the action. Just venturing half a mile outside - you could find yourself in somewhat third world conditions. The contrast is crazy. Basically when looking for a hotel, the closer to the Plaza the better.

Beautiful. Plaza de Armas in Cusco is beautiful and a place you must visit while in town, even if only briefly. The shops and restaurants surrounding the plaza are geared towards tourists so many be avoid those, but definitely take in everything else.

Nice for a wander and take in the vibe of Cusci. Me and my wife were here for Halloween 2015 and the square was magical. So many kids having fun and people letting their hair down. On a normal day though, the plaza is a nice place to wander round the shops or stop off in a bar or pub and watch the world go by. Well worth a trip here if you're in Cusco

Beautiful Plaza. The plaza is beautiful especially at night when its all lit up. It is a busy place with lots of vendors trying to sell trinkets. It is a great gathering place and wonderful spot to just stroll. Good restaurants line the plaza with many having balconies for viewing the plaza from inside.

Gorgeous square . I'll never forget the first time I walked in Plaza de Armas, it was such a stunning sight! I loved the hustle and bustle of all of the locals and tourists and the overall atmosphere is really pretty! The statue of Christ set in he mountains overlooking everything looks pretty unique lit up at night time. Beautiful square in Cusco.,

Beautiful location, Cusco summed up in a small block. Beautiful place, Cusco summed up in a small block. Just stand and take a look around and you'll be marveled by the city frozen in time.So much history, the architecture, the art that still lives. This is the place to be in cusco, you'll find fantastic restaurants, most of the most important landmarks and great hotels nearby. Must visit.

Beautiful and historic, filled with shops, food and ATMs. All the things you want/need are at your fingertips. Gear for the Inca Trail, good food to fill your belly, shops to pick up souvenirs, ATMs out the ying-yang! Our hostel was 2 blocks away, so this was the perfect location for us in Cusco!

Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. Busy day and night this is a great place to watch tourists and local trades people. I got some great photos just sitting on a bench. Don't be put off by the people selling their stuff a polite no and they leave you alone.
The central square. This was a pretty area that was central to all the shopping and restaurants in the area. You do not have to plan to go there as you will end up there anyway while you are in Cusco

Nice plaza. We spent three nights in Cuzco and this was our hang out every night there. What a beautiful place to spend time with our friends that we were traveling with. We all shared a bottle of wine, cheese, and many of empanada.
Spectacular at night. This is one of the most beautiful Plazas I have visited - at night it resembles fairyland with the lights of the surrounding hills enhancing the atmosphere.

Lovely place to people watch. Two churches and lots of people watching on this square. Although you will get a fair number pf people coming up and trying to sell you stuff, it is not as agresssive as other places.
Take your time. Don't miss the churches, explore the place... The local market is nearby, with food, juices... There will be a bunch of people there, so take it easy...

Such a beautiful main square. This is my 5th trip to Peru and I love spending time in Cusco in the main square.It is very well maintained. There are a lot of people trying to sell you stuff but once you say "no gracias" they move on. I don't find them aggressive at all. I would suggest travelling off of the main square to get better prices on food and gifts.
Nice. Nice place surrounded by beautiful churches and nice views. Probably this is the nicest plaza de armas in all Peru

A must. When visiting Cusco ,the square has been used in movies .The wonderful catherdral along one side ,when we were there there was a ceremony of some sort with people dressed as they processed around the square .Local women and children with alpacas ( who did not look particularly well ) were begging which needs to be stopped !!!Locals selling food ,we had a meal on a balcony overlooking the square and enjoyed watching what was going on .One evening after another meal we walked up and enjoyed the atmosphere.

Quite a Scene. This town center is a stunner surrounded by beautiful buildings and filled with fascinating people. Costumed women wishing to pose for pictures (and payment), vendors selling local crafts, bridal parties, tourists, local business people, all make their way around this beautifully landscaped square. In daytime, it is lovely to look down upon from second floor restaurants around the square, and processions and parades were underway on days we were there. Take the time to enjoy this vibrant area when you are in Cusco.

Good for people watching. This is a great place to see traditionally dressed Peruvians, some carrying alpacas (you will have to pay one soles for the privilege) others carrying babies, vendors selling everything from food to souvenirs, paintings, etc. This is a great spot to take photos of the cathedral too and it's not far to walk to the central market too.

Lots to see, do & eat.. The Cathedral is the highlight of Plaza de Armas. It is a shame that you cannot take flash photography in there but understandable. The square is a nice place to sit & people watch but be aware of the numerous people trying to sell their wares & clean your shoes. Numerous places to eat ( Including MacDonalds! ) & drink ( Including couple of Irish pubs ) in the square.
Beautiful vies. Lots of action and great views of the old churches. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area. This is where you buy train tickets to Agua calientes (Peru Rail to Machu picchu).
Busy Place with Lots of Shops. So I tend to avoid super busy areas but found Plaza de Armas to be manageable -- it is ringed with high end stores and delicious restaurants!

Comes alive during the festival of Cusco. We visited Cusco in June during the festival of Cusco- wow what an experience! Folk dancing, costumes, music and celebrations in the plaza and surrounding streets from early morning until late in the evening.

Beautiful Main Square.. This is definitely one of the most beautiful main squares I've ever seen. It also has a lot of history, over 500 years! It's a great place to visit during the day or the night.

So Beautiful!. This was one of my favorite places to walk around in all of Cusco. The Plaza has such a charm about it and it reminded me so much of a few European cities I had been too. There are so many great restaurants all around the plaza and so many things to do. This is by far one of my favorite paces in all of South America!

Fun Plaza where something fun is always going on!. The week during our stay, we experienced a Peruvian rock concert in the plaza. In addition, we marched in the protest & supported the thousands of people speaking out against the government privatizing Machu Picchu & other sacred sites. Loved the fact that these people are fighting for something so important instead of being "asleep at the wheel" The locals were very grateful that a bunch of us tourists got off our tour bus and chose to support the Peruvians in their march! Wishing the Peruvian people the best in this issue!
Great place to hang out and ppl watch. Great place to hang out and ppl watch. It's beautiful all lit up at night, you had all different characters that showed up here.
Good place to people watch. Central plaza with restaurants, bars and churches. Good place to just spend some time sitting and watching time go by.

Landmark place. This is the central point of the city. Start point of all the tours around the city. From here you can visit churches, like the cathedral or the San Blas. You can also can visit the Korikancha, an ancient incas sacred place we're the Spanish build a Cristian church on top of its bases.You can also do the walking around the churches and museums of the neighborhood. Enjoy the city.

Incredible Plaza. This is a great place to sit back, relax, and people watch. Since so many people come to Cusco from all around the world it never gets boring. Dining here too us great. Get a seat on a balcony and enjoy a cocktail, the food, and the view of the plaza and its churches. Shopping here too is a blast. If youbare looking for alpaca products this is the place. Their are many stores but my suggestion is to inquire about super baby alpaca products. Believe me you eill thank me later. Jewelry is abundant as well as ladies in native attire carrying baby alpacas. They are so cute and yes you can get a picture holding one for a few dollars.

Annoying sellers everywhere. This could be a nice park to sit in and enjoy if it weren't for the sellers. We were constantly approached by people selling trinkets, tours, shoe shines and lamb photos. Some asked several times over. A few of the lambs didn't look very healthy and the women would try and thrust them at you so you couldn't say no easily. The shops and restaurants aren't anything special either. The church is ok. I'd recommend quickly passing through and sitting in one of the smaller parks nearby if you want to relax in a green space

All our free time. Every time we walked by the Plaza we would just sit in a bench, enjoy the surrounding, and see people and interact with them. One day we bought nice fresh, just made bread, and we shared with everyone that approached us. It was a wonderful experience
VG. This plaza is the historic center of old Cuzco. Just look in an direction and you'll be surrounded by amazing architecture and treats for the eyes.
so pretty. beautiful at night, lots of people trying to sell things to the tourists, but worth an afternoon looking around

Just in time for El día de turismo. the biggest square in Cusco was within 10minute walking distance from my hotel, with an open square and many restaurants and shops that encircled the square. I was lucky enough to have gone to Plaza de Armas when the parade and spectacle was coming through. Definitely saw how vibrant the people, colors and culture was that day.

Lively plaza, lots of people watching . We spent a week in Cusco before doing the inca trail. Plaza de Armas always seemed to have some form of celebration or Festival marching through the square. Lots of interesting people to watch from one of the numerous cafes or restaurants surrounding the plaza. Slightly annoying touts trying to sell massages and art, but definitely worthwhile visiting.
nice plaza. The plaza is nicest when it's quiet, though it's often the site of large concerts or community plays. There are lots of cool shops lining the plaza as well.

Essential, even better on a Sunday. You can't really go to Cusco without going here. Go on a Sunday and see the morning parade, where local community groups, unions and schoolchildren parade past the mayor. Lots of sights and sounds. There are also great churches and restaurants in the square that are worth checking out.
Amazing. Great view, good food, warm people, free walking tour with marco (the blue shirt), safe, lot of restaurants, but you should look for the good ones out of the square.
Centre Square Cusco. Well worth the visit and stroll around the square and Cathedral right in the centre of Cusco. Many shops are located in the are around the square and fountain.

Quaint in Its Own Right, an Inca Parade Adds a Lot of Colour. We were fortunate that in in the single day we spent in Cusco we arrived from visiting Sacsayhuaman just in time to enjoy a very colourful parade through the Plaza de Aramas (see pics). It reminded me of the homecoming parade of the Florida Gators in Gainesville during my study days at the University of Florida.

Beautiful space, but you will be hawked to death by street vendors. The Plaza is striking and the park is lovely. However, if you are obviously a tourist (and it's hard to hide this -- you don't have to be dressed like you're on Safari to stick out), you will be approached by someone every 2-3 steps urging you to check out something they're selling or look at a menu or take a tour. It can get to be a little much. Having said that, my wife and I still wound up walking through the square all the time because it's beautiful and because there's so much worthwhile to check out in the area. It's also often on the way to many things if you happen to be staying in the vicinity. In the end, I'd recommend it so long as you either don't mind this sort of thing or you're prepared to put on your "million-mile-stare" and stride right on through to wherever you're going.
Start here. Great place to start a visit in Cusco. Central location with a lot of activity. Great restaurants and good shopping in the square.

Nice to wander around. Cusco is a nice city, but its main square summarises the best it has to offer. The views are wonderful, with the Cathedral, the Temple of the Company of Jesus, covered galleries and nearby mountains. I spent there a lot of time during my stay in Cusco. Also recommend a night visit, and after raining, as the wet cobbles give it a distinctive charisma. Don´t hurry and let the magic of this city catch you.

Tourist Central. Great architecture!. The plaza is surrounded by shops on 2+ sides and the cathedrals take up the rest. Great views around the area. We happened upon a Catholic street parade/celebration and enjoyed the colorful costumes, bands and dances. We wandered around the surrounding streets and at a a great local restaurant a block away. You need to ask where to eat that is not a tourist restaurant and is frequented by locals. (Ordered too much food). Lots of police in the entire area so we felt safe in the day and evenings.

Main square of Cusco. This the main square of Cisco with a Cathedral and political buildings and shops surrounding it. There is always a lot of activity here. We watched a student demonstration pass through the plaza while we were there.

Beautiful Plaza full of cathedrals and restaurants. This is a beautiful place that you can walk to from many hotels. It's full of restaurants and sometimes demonstrations. It's beautifully lit at night and looks great from the 2nd story balcony of a restaurant while having a beer or eating dinner.

Beautiful Square, Particularly Lovely at Night. If the Lima Plaza de Armas is beautiful, the Cuzco one goes one step further. Surrounded by mountains, the square is particularly gorgeous at night, with lighting both natural and electrical creating a delightful atmosphere. There is an eclectic mish mash of cathedrals, markets, restaurants, and stores around - do walk around at day and night - they are each a unique experience.

Not as enjoyable as it should be. Like most cities in South America, the Plaza de Armas is the central place with lot of activity. Cusco is no exception. The plaza does in fact look lovely, in the day time and also at night. It gets its 2 stars for that. The problem with the plaza is that it's scam central. You will never be left alone to enjoy the beauty of it. The local touts will harass you endlessly trying to see you tours. It's really not possible to enjoy. I always found myself avoiding the plaza or walking through as quickly as possible, which is a pity.
Full of interesting architecture. The hub of Cusco- tranquil but full of life when there are fiestas, demonstrations etc. Beautiful churches around the square and delightful at night

Beautiful lively plaza that is the hub for all the restaurants, cathedrals and sale items. . Beautiful lively plaza that is the hub for all the restaurants, cathedrals and sale items. The heart of the tourist industry!

Wonderful plaza!. We really loved the Plaza de Armas and spent as much time there as possible while in Cusco. Beautiful colonial plaza which reminded us a bit of the much smaller plaza in Santa Fe NM. This plaza has not one, but two cathedrals! Definitely worth visiting. The plaza is filled with people morning to night. We were fortunate to catch a parade in the plaza which was lively and brought out tons of locals. Really fun. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from right on the plaza, as well as a bank, shops, and the central courtyard area with fountain and benches. Just a delightful place to hang out. On a sunny day, some great photo ops. And if it is rainy- pop into the Starbucks and grab a warm drink. We enjoyed this plaza rain and shine!
Plaza de Armas Cusco. Very cool place..lots going on ...went back in the evening and found some great salsa clubs. Safe area, people nice, good selection of food and drink

Spoiled . The square is very pretty and well looked after. It is very safe as there is always an obvious police presence. The surrounding streets are closed to traffic in the evenings. It is a bustling place always filled with lots of tourists. It is lined by the Cusco cathedral, many restaurants, cafes, shops - mostly all selling the same things, money exchanges and tour operators. The features that spoiled it for us were: 1) the gross opulence of the cathedral (the finest gold and silver inside) contrasted by homeless people and beggars just outside in the square, 2) the constant barrage of people coming up to you wanting to sell you hats, trinkets, sunglasses, a massage, etc and 3) you can't walk past a restaurant without someone pestering you to come in and eat. We often got the feeling that we just wanted to get away from these things.

fun!. This Plaza is a great fun walking adventure. There are great shops, coffee houses , retail therapy and great people watching around this square. It is especially busy during celebration times as this is the place everyone goes.

Hang out at the fountain -- take it all in. Heart of the city with lots of people, a cathedral to check out, more restaurants than you'll be able to eat at, not to mention Starbucks for those who can't wait.
A True town square. Very active with street venders and restaurants for every pallet. Take pictures with the Local women and children. A beautiful center of the city where people gather.
Great Plaza. Really pleasant, bustling central plaza, with lots of decent cafes, bars, and restaurants around it which are perfect people-watching places.

Nice center of town. . This is a great place to watch people, relax, have a meal, and orient yourself. There are some great shops by the Inca museum that benefit the local tribes and children and the Inca/Venezuelan restaurant has the most amazing chili! This is a nice place to see some history and another religious structure...if you're into that.

Vibrant and fun! Full of culture on the weekends & great food shopping & nightlife!. Gorgeous cathedral and lots of action! Weekends are awesome Sundays they have their military march through which is an amazing site. Really good vibes, awesome restaurants, shops, bars, nightlife, and tourist agencies. Pay the 10 soles to visit the cathedral - great views of the city!
